translation.en: Edgar Veguilla received arm and jaw wounds while Kristoffer Schneider was left requiring reconstructive surgery for his face.
translation.ig: Edgar Veguilla merụrụ ahụ n'aka na n'agba ma Kristoffer Schneider bụ onye mmerụ ahụ ya ga-ewe ihe ọwụwa maka ihu ya.

translation.en: Uka's weapon failed whilst pointed at a fifth man's head. Schneider has ongoing pain, blindness in one eye, a missing section of skull and a face rebuilt from titanium.
translation.ig: Ngwa agha Uka dara dị ka ọ tụwara ya n’isi ony nke ise. Schneider nwere ụfụ ka na-afụ, anya ọkpụkpọ n’otu anya, akụkụ okpokoro isi furu efu na ihu arụgharịrị site na taịtenọm.

translation.en: Schneider testified via videolink from a USAF base in his homeland.
translation.ig: Schnaida ji ihe vidiyo si na ọnọdụ USAF kwupụta okwu.

translation.en: Beyond Wednesday's event, Carpanedo competed in two individual races at the Championships.
translation.ig: N’ofe mmemme Wednesdee ahụ, Carpanedo zọrọ asọmpi n’ọsọ ụgbọala abụọ n’Asọmpi Iko ahụ.

translation.en: Her first was the Slalom, where she earned a Did Not Finish in her first run. 36 of the 116 competitors had the same result in that race.
translation.ig: Nke mbụ ya bụ Slalom ahụ, ebe o ritara otu Agbachaghị n'ọsọ mbụ ya. Mmadụ 36 n'ime 116 sọrọ mpi ahụ nwetara otu ihe ahụ n'ọsọ ahụ.

translation.en: Her other race, the Giant Slalom, saw her finish in tenth in the women's sitting group with a combined run time of 4:41.30, 2:11.60 minutes slower than first place finisher Austrian Claudia Loesch and 1:09.02 minutes slower than the ninth place finisher Gyöngyi Dani of Hungary.
translation.ig: N'ọsọ ya nke ọzọ, Giant Slalom, ọ gbachara dị ka onye nke iri n'otu ụmụ nwanyị nọ ọdụ ebe oge ọsọ ya niile bụ nkeji 4: 41.30, nke ji nkeji 2: 11.60 nọrọ n'azụ onye nke mbụ Claudia Loesch onye Austria ma jiri nkeji 1: 09.02 nọrọ n'azụ Gyöngyi Dani onye Hungary gbara onye nke itoolu.

translation.en: Four skiers in the women's sitting group failed to finish their runs, and 45 of the 117 total skiers in the Giant Slalom failed to rank in the race.
translation.ig: Skiers anọ nwanyị nọ n'otu ụmụ nwanyị dara ịgbacha ọsọ ha, na 45 n'ime skiers 117 nọ na Giant Slalom dara isonye na ndị gbatara ihe n'egwuregwu ahụ.

translation.en: The Madhya Pradesh Police recovered the stolen laptop and mobile phone.
translation.ig: Ndị uwe ojii Madhya Pradesh weghachitela nkùnụkwụ na ekwentị kengagharị ndị e zuru n'ohi.

translation.en: Deputy Inspector General D K Arya said, "We have arrested five persons who raped the Swiss woman and recovered her mobile and laptop".
translation.ig: Onye na-esote Onye Isi Ndị Uweojii bụ D K Arya kwuru sị, "Anyị anwụchiela mmadụ ise ndị dinara n'ike nwanyị Swiss ahụ ma napụtakwa ekwentị na nkùnụkwụ ya".

translation.en: The accused are named as Baba Kanjar, Bhutha Kanjar, Rampro Kanjar, Gaza Kanjar and Vishnu Kanjar.
translation.ig: Ndị eboro ebubo bụ Baba Kanjar, Bhutha Kanjar, Rampro Kanjar, Gaza Kanjar na Vishnu Kanjar.

translation.en: Police superintendent Chandra Shekhar Solanki said the accused appeared in court with covered faces.
translation.ig: Onye isi ndị uweojii Chandra Shekhar Solanki sị na ndị eboro ebubo kpuchiri ihu bịa n'ụlọ ikpe.

translation.en: Although three people were inside the house when the car impacted it, none of them were hurt.
translation.ig: Obu eziokwu na mmadu ato no nime ulo ahu mgbe ugbo-ala ahu kuru ya, onweghi onye nime ha meruru ahu.

translation.en: However, the driver sustained serious injuries to the head.
translation.ig: N'agbanyeghị nke a, onye ọkwọ ụgbọ merụrụ ezigbo ahụ n'isi.

translation.en: The road where the crash happened was temporarily closed while emergency services freed the driver from the red Audi TT.
translation.ig: E mechiri nwa oge okporo ụzọ ahụ ebe ihe mberede mere ebe ndị ọrụ mberede tọhapụrụ onye ọkwọ ụgbọ ala ahụ site na Audi TT na-acha uhie.

translation.en: He was initially hospitalised in the James Paget Hospital in Great Yarmouth.
translation.ig: Ọ nọbu n'ụlọ ọgwụ Jems Pajet dị na Gret Yamawụt.

translation.en: He was subsequently relocated to Addenbrooke's Hospital in Cambridge.
translation.ig: E mechara kwagarịa ya n’Ụlọ ọgwụ Addenbrooke na Kembriji.

translation.en: Adekoya has since been in Edinburgh Sheriff Court charged with murdering her son.
translation.ig: Adekọya anọrọla n'Ụlọ ikpe Obodo Edịnbọg ebe eboro ya ebubo maka igbu nwa ya nwoke.

translation.en: She is in custody pending indictment and trial, but any eyewitness evidence may be tainted because her image has been widely published.
translation.ig: Atụrụ ya nga ma na-eche ikpe, mana akụkọ ọgba ama ọbụla nwere ike ịbụ nke rụrụ arụ n'ihi na ebipụtara onyonyo ya ọfụma.

translation.en: This is common practice elsewhere in the UK but Scottish justice works differently and courts have viewed publication of photos as potentially prejudicial.
translation.ig: Nke a bụ omume a na-ahụkarị ebe ndị ọzọ na UK mana íkpé íkpē Scottish na-arụ ọrụ n'ụzọ dị iche ma ụlọ ikpe eleela mbipụta nke fotò gasị dị ka ihe nwere ike ịbụ ajọ mbunobi.

translation.en: Professor Pamela Ferguson of the University of Dundee notes "journalists do seem to be walking a dangerous line if publishing photos etc of suspects."
translation.ig: Ọkachamara Pamela Ferguson nke Mahadum Dundee kwuru "ndị nta akụkọ dị ka ndị na-aga ije n'ebe dị oke egwu ma ọ bụrụ na ha ebipụta foto na ihe ndị ọzọ nke ndị a na-enyo enyo."

translation.en: Crown Office, which is in overall charge of prosecutions, has indicated to journalists that no further comment will be made at least until indictment.
translation.ig: Ụlọ ọrụ Krawn, nke nọ n'isi amamikpe, agwala ndị nta akụkọ na ha agaghị ekwu okwu gbasara okwu akpụ n'ọnụ ozo ruo mgbe amara mmadụ ikpe.

translation.en: The document, according to the leak, will refer to the borders dispute, which Palestine wants based on the borders before the 1967 Mideast War.
translation.ig: Dọkumentị ahụ, na-ndabere na ohihiahụ, ga-arụnye aka na ụmụ mgbagha oke ala ndị ahụ, nke Palestaịnụ chọrọ na-ndabere n’ụmụ oke ala tupu Agha Mideast 1967 ahụ.

translation.en: Other topics covered reportedly include the future state of Jerusalem which is sacred to both nations and the Jordan Valley issue.
translation.ig: Isiokwu ndị ọzọ ekpuchiri gụnyere site n'ihe akọrọ ọdịnihu Jerusalem nke dị nsọ nye mba abụọ ahụ na okwu Ndagwurugwu Jọdan.

translation.en: Israel demands an ongoing military presence in the valley for ten years once an agreement is signed while the PA agrees to leave such presence only for five years.
translation.ig: Israel na-achọ ka ndị agha nọrọ na ndagwụrụgwụ a ruo afọ iri ozigbo abanyere na nkwekọrịta, mana PA chọrọ ka ndị agha a nọrọ ruo naanị afọ ise.

translation.en: Shooters in the supplementary pest control trial were to be closely supervised by rangers, as the trial was monitored and its effectiveness evaluated.
translation.ig: Ndị nche legidere ndị ọgbaa anya nke ọma ka ha mere nnwale njikwa ọtapịapịa nke ntụkwasị, dịka e lebara anya na nnwale ahụ ma tụlee ma ọ dị ire.

translation.en: In a partnership of NPWS and the Sporting Shooters Association of Australia (NSW) Inc, qualified volunteers were recruited, under the Sporting Shooters Association's hunting program.
translation.ig: N’ime otu mmekọrịta nke NPWS na Sporting Shooters Association of Australia (NSW) Inc, e were n’ọrụ ndị ọrụ afọ ofufo tozuru oke, n’okpuru mmemme ịchụ nta nke Sporting Shooters Association ahụ.

translation.en: According to Mick O'Flynn, the Acting Director Park Conservation and Heritage with the NPWS, the four shooters selected for the first shooting operation received comprehensive safety and training instruction.
translation.ig: Dị ka Mik O'Flynn, Onye isi ọrụ na NPWS na-ahụ maka Ndokwa Ogige na Nketa, kwuru, ndị ọgba egbe anọ a họọrọ maka mmemme ọgbụgba nke mbụ bụ ndị akuzigorola nchekwa ma nye ha ọzụzụ.

translation.en: Martelly swore in a new Provisional Electoral Council (CEP) of nine members yesterday.
translation.ig: Martelly n̄ụrụ iyi n’ime otu Kansụl Ntuli aka Kenwa oge (CEP) ọhụrụ nke ndịòtù itoollu ụnyaahụ.

translation.en: It is Martelly's fifth CEP in four years.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ CEP nke ise nke Marteli n'afọ anọ.

translation.en: Last month a presidential commission recommended the prior CEP's resignation as part of a package of measures to move the country towards new elections.
translation.ig: N'ọnwa gara aga ozi sitere n'onye ọchịchị kwadoro ọgbụgba arụkwaghịm CEP nọbu anọ dịka ihe so n'usoro omume ihe ibuje obodo na ntuli aka ọhụrụ

translation.en: The commission was Martelly's response to widespread anti-regime protests that started in October.
translation.ig: Ntinye ọrụ ahụ bụ azịza Martelly maka ngagharị iwe nke mgbochi ọchịchị zuru ebe niile nke bidoro na Ọktoba.

translation.en: The sometimes-violent protests were triggered by failure to hold elections, some due since 2011.
translation.ig: Ụmụ ngagharị iwe a na-alụ ọgụ mgbe ụfọdụ na ya bụ ọdịda ime ntuli aka kpatara ya, ụfọdụ etozuola kemgbe 2011.

translation.en: Around 60 cases of malfunctioning iPods overheating have been reported, causing a total of six fires and leaving four people with minor burns.
translation.ig: E kwuputala na na e nweela nsogbu 60 sitere na iPods ndị n'anaghị arụ ọrụ nke ọma na-ekwo oke ọkụ, nke na-ebutala ọkụ ọgbụgba isii merụrụ ndị mmadụ ahụ obere.

translation.en: Japan's Ministry of Economy, Trade and Industry (METI) said that it had been aware of 27 accidents related to the devices.
translation.ig: Ministri Japan nke Akụnụba, Azụmaahịa na Ụlọ ọrụ mmepụta (METI) kwuru na ọ ma ama maka ihe mberede iri abụọ na asaa metụtara njìarụ ndị ahụ.

translation.en: Last week, METI announced that Apple had informed it of 34 additional overheating incidents, which the company called "non-serious."
translation.ig: N'izuka gara aga, METI mara okwa sị na Apple gwara ya gbasara oke ekpomoku iri atọ na anọ merenụ, nke ụlọ ọrụ kpọrọ "ihe na-abụghị ihe."

translation.en: The ministry responded by calling Apple's postponement of the report "truly regrettable."
translation.ig: Ụlọ ozi zaghachiri sị na mbugharị oge rịpọt Apple mere dị "mwute n'ezie".

translation.en: The eathquake struck Mariana at 07:19 a.m. local time (09:19 p.m. GMT Friday).
translation.ig: Ala ọma jijiji ahụ mere Mariana na 07:19 elekere ụtụtụ mpaghara (09:19 p.m. GMT Friday).

translation.en: The Northern Marianas emergency management office said that there were no damages reported in the nation.
translation.ig: Ụlọ ọrụ nlekọta ihe mberede nke Nọtan Marianas sị na onweghị mmebi ihe akọpụtara n'obodo.

translation.en: Also the Pacific Tsunami Warning Center said that there was no Tsunami indication.
translation.ig: Ụlọọrụ ịdọ aka na ntị n'ihe gbasara ebili mmiri nke Pasifiki sị na onweghi ihe gosiri na ebili mmiri na-abịa.

translation.en: A former Filipino policeman has kept Hong Kong tourists hostage by hijacking their bus in Manila, the capital of the Philippines.
translation.ig: Otu onye Filipino wụbụrụ onye uwe ojii edobela ndị njem nleta Hong Kong na njigide site n’ịkwụsị n’ike bọọsụ ha n’ime Manila, isiobodo nke ndị Filipaịnụ.

translation.en: Rolando Mendoza fired his M16 rifle at the tourists.
translation.ig: Rolando Mendoza gbara egbe ya bụ M16 n’ebe ndị njem nọ.

translation.en: Several hostages have been rescued and least six have been confirmed dead so far.
translation.ig: Azọpụtara ọtụtụ ndị eji èji ma mmadụ isii ka ekwuru na ha anwụọla.

translation.en: Six hostages, including the children and elderly, were released early, as were the Filipino photographers.
translation.ig: Ndị ejigidere ejigide isii, tinyere ụmụaka na ndị okenye, ka ahapụrụ n'oge, ma ndị Filipino n'ese foto.

translation.en: The photographers later took the place of an aged lady as she needed the lavatory. Mendoza was gunned down.
translation.ig: Ndị ose foto ahụ mechara nọchie otu agadi nwanyị dịka ọ gara ụlọmposi. A gbagburu Mendoza.

translation.en: Liggins followed in his father’s footsteps and entered a career in medicine.
translation.ig: Liggins soro n’uzoụkwụ nna ya ma banye n’ọrụ ọgwụ.

translation.en: He trained as an obstetrician and began to work at the Auckland's National Women's Hospital in 1959.
translation.ig: Ọ zụrụ ọzụzụ dị ka ọkachamara nke nne na-amụ nwa wee malite ịrụ ọrụ na Ụlọ Ọgwụ Ndị Inyom Nke ala Auckland na 1959.

translation.en: While he was working at the hospital Liggins began to investigate premature labor during his spare time.
translation.ig: Mgbe ọ na-arụ ọrụ n'ụlọ ọgwụ Liggins malitere inyocha ọmụmụ nwa akaghị aka n'oge ezumike ya.

translation.en: His research showed that if a hormone was administered it would speed up the baby's foetal lung maturation.
translation.ig: Nlebaanya ya gosiri na e nye homonu, ọ ga-eme ka nkuume nwata dị n'afọ tozuo oke ọsịsọ karịa.

translation.en: Xinhua reported that government investigators recovered two 'black box' flight recorders on Wednesday.
translation.ig: Xinhua kwuru na ndị nnyocha gọọmenti chọtara igwe 'igbe ojii' na-edokọ etu njem ụgbọelu si gaa na Wenezdee.

translation.en: Fellow wrestlers also paid tribute to Luna.
translation.ig: Ndị mgba ibe ha mere ihe ndị gosiri nkwanye ugwu nye Luna.

translation.en: Tommy Dreamer said "Luna was the first Queen of Extreme. My first manager. Luna passed away on the night of two moons. Pretty unique just like her. Strong woman."
translation.ig: Tọmi Drima sị na "Luna bụ Eze nwaanyị ihe ngabiga oke nke mbụ. Onye nlekwa ọrụ m nke mbụ. Luna nwụrụ n'abalị ọnwa abụọ. Ọ pụrụ iche dị ka ya. Nwaanyị siri ike."

translation.en: Dustin "Goldust" Runnels commented that "Luna was as freaky as me...maybe even more...love her and will miss her...hopefully she's in a better place."
translation.ig: Dọstin "Goldọst" Runnels sị na "Luna na-eme ihe ndị ara ka m...onwere ike karịa... ahụrụ m ya n'anya aga m na atụkwa anya ya... Enwerem olileanya na ọnọ ebe ka mma."

translation.en: Out of 1,400 people polled prior to the 2010 federal election, those who oppose Australia becoming a republic grew by 8 per cent since 2008.
translation.ig: N'ime mmadụ otu puku na iri anọ tụrụ ụtụ tupu ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị gọọmenti etiti nke afọ 2010, ndị megidere mba Ọstrelia ịbụ obodo kwuuru onwe ya ji pasentị asatọ rịa elu kemgbe afọ 2008.

translation.en: Caretaker Prime Minister Julia Gillard claimed during the campaign of the 2010 federal election that she believed Australia should become a republic at the end of Queen Elizabeth II's reign.
translation.ig: Onye nlekota ala (Caretaker Prime Minister) Julia Gillard kwuru n’oge Kampeenu nke nhoputa ndi ochichi nke goomenti etiti na okwere na Australia kwesiri ibu repoblik ma Eze nwanyi Elizabeth nke abuo chicha.

translation.en: 34 per cent of those in the poll share this view, wanting Queen Elizabeth II to be Australia's last monarch.
translation.ig: 34 nime-otu-nari-nile bu ndi tinyere aka na ntuli aka ahu n’enwe otu uche ahu, n’acho ka Eze-nwanyi Elizabeth II buru onye eze nke ikpeazu nke Australia.

translation.en: At the extremes of the poll, 29 per cent of those surveyed believe Australia should become a republic as soon as possible, while 31 per cent believe Australia should never become a republic.
translation.ig: Ka ịtụ vootu nọ na ngwụcha, pasentị iri abụọ na itolu n'ime ndị elebaara anya kwenyere na Ọstrelia kwesịrị ịbụrụ mba nọọrọ onwe ya ngwa ngwa, ebe pasentị iri atọ na otu kwenyere na Ọstrelia ekwesịghị ịbụ obodo nọọrọ onwe ya.

translation.en: The Olympic gold medalist was due to swim in the 100m and 200m freestyle and in three relays at the Commonwealth Games, but due to his complaints his fitness has been in doubt.
translation.ig: Onye nwebụrụ mgbanye ọlaedo Olympicruru igwu mmiri na nke 100m na 200m ụdị nnwere onwe na ngwụgharị ugboro atọ n'Egwuregwu Commonwealth ahụ, mana n’ihi mkpesa ya, enweela obi abụọ maka ịdị mma nke ahụike ya.

translation.en: He has been unable to take the drugs needed to overcome his pain as they are banned from the Games.
translation.ig: O nwebeghị ike ịn̄ụ ọgwụ ndị ahụ o kwesịrị iji merie mgbu ya dị ka a machibidoro ha iwu site n’Egwuregwu.

translation.en: Curtis Cooper, a mathematician and computer science professor at the University of Central Missouri, has discovered the largest known prime number to date on January 25.
translation.ig: Curtis Cooper, onye ọka mmụta mgbakọ na mwepụ na onye ọka mmụta sayensị kọmputa na Mahadum nke Etiti Missouri, achọpụtala akara praịm kachasị buo ibu ruo ta na Jenụwarị 25.

translation.en: Several people verified the discovery using different hardware and software by the beginning of February and it was announced on Tuesday.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ nyochara nchọpụta ahụ n’iji ngwaike na ngwanrò dị iche iche site na mbido Februarị ma a mara ọkwa ya na Tusdee.

translation.en: Comets may possibly have been a source of water delivery to the earth along with organic matter that can form proteins and support life.
translation.ig: Ụmụ Kọmetị nwere ike ịbụ isi mmalite nnefe mmiri nye ụwa ya na ihe dị ndụ nwere ike ịmepụta ụmụ protiin ma kwado ndụ.

translation.en: Scientists hope to understand how planets form, especially how the Earth formed, since comets collided with the Earth long ago.
translation.ig: Ndị ọka mmụta sayensị nwere olileanya ịghọta ka uwa dị iche iche sị kpụọ, ọkachasị otu ụwa anyị siri kpụọ, kemgbe okwute igwe na ụwa anyị sukọkọ isi n'ote aka.

translation.en: Cuomo, 53, began his governorship earlier this year and signed a bill last month legalizing same-sex marriage.
translation.ig: Kuomo, onye dị afọ iri ise na atọ, bidoro ọchịchị gọọmenti steeti na mbido afọ a ma binye aka n'ọnwa gara aga n'iwu kwadoro mmekọahụ nwoke na nwoke maọbụ nwanyị na nwanyị.

translation.en: He referred to the rumors as "political chatter and silliness".
translation.ig: Ọ kpọrọ asịrị ndị ahụ "mkparịta ụka ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị na nzuzu".

translation.en: He is speculated to make a run for president in 2016.
translation.ig: A na-aka na ọ ga-azọ ọkwa onye isi ala n'afọ 2016.

translation.en: NextGen is a system the FAA claims would allow aircraft to fly shorter routes and save millions of gallons of fuel each year and cut carbon emissions.
translation.ig: NextGen bụ otu sistemụ FAA na-asị ga-enye ụgbọ elu òhèerè ife site n’ụzọ kara pee mpe ma chekwa ọtụtụ nde galọnụ nke mmanụ kwa afọ na mkpọfụ anwụrụ.

translation.en: It uses satellite-based technology as opposed to older ground-radar-based technology to allow air traffic controllers to pinpoint aircraft with greater precision and give pilots more accurate information.
translation.ig: O ji teknụzụ satilaịti dị iche na teknụzụ rada nọ n'ala were enyere ndị na-ejikwa nfegharị ụgbọelu aka ịma ebe ụgbọelu nọ kpọmkwem ma nyekwa ndị ọkwọ ụgbọelu ozi ziri ezi.

translation.en: No extra transport is being put on and overground trains will not stop at Wembley, and car parking and park-and-ride facilities are unavailable at the ground.
translation.ig: Anaghị etinyekwasị ihe njem, ma ụgbọoloko elu ala agaghị akwụsị na Wembli, ma ndowe ụgbọala makwa akụrụngwa dowe ma gbakwaa adịghị ebe ahụ.

translation.en: Fears of lack of transportation raised the possibility that the game would be forced to play behind closed doors without the team's supporters.
translation.ig: Ụjọ ụbịam ụzọ njem mere na onwere ike ndị egwuregwu ga egwu n'enweghị ndị nkwado ha.

translation.en: A study published on Thursday in the journal Science reported on formation of a new bird species on the Ecuadorean Galápagos Islands.
translation.ig: Otu mmụta e bipụtara na Tọzdee n’ime jọnaalụ Sayensi kọrọ na mwube nke otu ụdị nnụnụ ọhụrụ na Agwaetiti Galápagos nke Ikuedọ.

translation.en: Researchers from Princeton University in the United States and Uppsala University in Sweden reported the new species evolved in just two generations, though this process had been believed to take much longer, due to breeding between an endemic Darwin finch, Geospiza fortes, and the immigrant cactus finch, Geospiza conirostris.
translation.ig: Ndị nchọcha sitere na Mahadum Princeton dị na mba Amerịka na Mahadum Uppsala dị na mba Sweden kọwara ụdịdị ọhụrụ pụtara na naanị ọgbọ abụọ, ọ bụ ezie na ụkpụrụ a ka e chere na ọ na-ewe oge karịa, n'ihi ọmụmụ n’etiti otu ụdị nnụnụ bụ Dawin Finchi na-ebi otu ebe, Jiospiza Fọtisi, nakwa Kakụtus Finchi si esi bata, Jiospiza konirostrisi.

translation.en: Gold may be worked into all sorts of shapes. It can be rolled into tiny shapes.
translation.ig: E nwere ike ịrụpụta ọla edo n'ime ụdị ụdịdị niile. E nwere ike ịpịakọta ya n'ime ụdịdị ndị pere mpe.

translation.en: It can be pulled into thin wire, which can be twisted and plaited. It can be hammered or rolled into sheets.
translation.ig: Enwere ike itinye ya n'ime waya girigiri, nke e nwere ike ịghịkọta ma tee ya ihe otite. Enwere ike itisa ya ma ọ bụ rọkụlọ ya n'ime mpempe akwụkwọ.

translation.en: It can be made very thin, and stuck onto other metal. It can be made so thin that it was sometimes used to decorate the hand-painted pictures in books called "illuminated manuscripts".
translation.ig: Enwere ike ime ya ọ dị oke gịrịgịrị, ma mado ya n'ahụ igwe ọzọ. Enwere ike ime ya ọ dị oke gịrịgịrị ruo na ụfọdụ oge eji ya achọ ọrụ agba ejiri aka tee n'akwụkwọ akpọrọ "akwụkwọ ihe ngosi" mma.

translation.en: This is called a chemical's pH. You can make an indicator using red cabbage juice.
translation.ig: A na-akpọ nke a PH nke kemịkal. I nwere ike ịme ihe ngosi site na iji mmiri kabeeji na-acha ọbara ọbara

translation.en: The cabbage juice changes color depending on how acidic or basic (alkaline) the chemical is.
translation.ig: Ihu mmanya kabej a na-agbanwe agba dabere na otu kemikal ya si dị asidik maọbụ bezik (alkaline).

translation.en: The pH level is indicated by the amount of Hydrogen (the H in pH) ions in the tested chemical.
translation.ig: Nha nke ayọn Hydrogen nọ na kemịkal ọbụla bụ ihe na-egosi ogo pH ya.

translation.en: Hydrogen ions are protons that had their electrons stripped off them (since Hydrogen atoms consist of one proton and one electron).
translation.ig: Ayọn Haịdrojin bụ protọn anaarala elektrọn ya (ebe atọm Haịdrojin nwere otu protọn na otu elektrọn).

translation.en: Swirl the two dry powders together and then, with clean wet hands, squeeze them into a ball.
translation.ig: Kpaharia kota nzu abuo ahu kporo-nku onu ma mgbe-ahu, na aka di mmiri ma dikwa ocha, pikoo ha ka ha ghoo boolu.

translation.en: The moisture on your hands will react with the outer layers, which will feel funny and form a sort of shell.
translation.ig: Mpụta ya na mmiri dị gị n'aka ga-enwe mmekọrịta, nke ga-enye gị mmetụta dị aghaa ma mepụta ihe dị ka ọkpụkpụ mkpuchi.

translation.en: The cities of Harappa and Mohenjo-daro had a flush toilet in almost every house, attached to a sophisticated sewage system.
translation.ig: Ọ fọrọ obere ka ụlọ niile dị n'obodo Harappa na Mohenjo-daro nwee mpochi mmiri, ya na usoro mkpopu kara aka.

translation.en: Remains of sewage systems have been found in the houses of the Minoan cities of Crete and Santorini in Greece.
translation.ig: A chọtala sistemu nsi fọdụrụnụ n’ụlọ Minoan ndị dị n’obodo Crete na Santorini na Greece

translation.en: There were also toilets in ancient Egypt, Persia and China. In Roman civilization, toilets were sometimes part of public bath houses where men and women were together in mixed company.
translation.ig: Ha nwekwara ụlọ mposi n'Ijipt mgbe ochie, Peshia na Chaịna. N'okpuru ọchịchị ndị Rom, mgbe ụfọdụ ụlọ mposi na-abụkarị otu akụkụ nke ụlọ ọsịsa ahụ ọha ebe ụmụ nwoke na ụmụ nwanyị nọkọtara ọnụ.

translation.en: When you call someone who is thousands of miles away, you are using a satellite.
translation.ig: Mgbe ikporo mmadu onye no otutu puku maili site n’ebe ino , ihe iji bu igwe satalaiti.

translation.en: The satellite in space gets the call and then reflects it back down, almost instantly.
translation.ig: Satilaịti nọ n'ikuku na enweta oku ma zighachi ya n'ala na ntabi anya.

translation.en: The satellite was sent into space by a rocket. Scientists use telescopes in space because the Earth’s atmosphere distorts some of our light and view.
translation.ig: E ji ụgbọelu rọkeetị zije satilaịti n'ikuku. Ndị ọka mmụta sayensị na eji igwe nyocha kpakpando afụ ụzọ n'ikuku mpụga ụwa n'ihi na igwe ụwa anyị na arọgharị ụfọdụ ọkụ anyị na ahụ.

translation.en: It takes a giant rocket over a 100 feet high to put a satellite or telescope in space.
translation.ig: O na-ewe nnukwu rọketi gafere ụkwụ otu narị n’elu itinye otu satịlaịtị na teliskop n’eluụwa.

translation.en: The wheel has changed the world in incredible ways. The biggest thing that the wheel has done for us is given us much easier and faster transportation.
translation.ig: Wiilu agbanweela ụwa n'ụdị enweghị atụ. Ihe kachasị ukwu nke wiilu merela anyị bụ na o nyere anyị ụzọ njem dị mfe ma dị ọsịsọ karịa.

translation.en: It has brought us the train, the car, and many other transportation devices.
translation.ig: O wetegoro anyị ụgbọoloko, ụgbọala na ọtụtụ akụrụngwa njem dị iche iche.

translation.en: Under them are more medium sized cats that eat medium sized prey ranging from rabbits to antelopes and deer.
translation.ig: N'okpuru ha bụ ụmụ nwamba ha ọkara na-eri anụoriri ha ọkara nke nwere ike isi na oke bekee ruo na ele nakwa mgbada.

translation.en: Finally, there are many small cats (including loose pet cats) that eat the far more numerous small prey like insects, rodents, lizards, and birds.
translation.ig: N’ikpeazụ, e nwere ọtụtụ obere nwamba (gụnyere anụ ụlọ nwamba furu efu) na-eri ọtụtụ obere ụmụ anụmanụ dị ka ụmụ ahụhụ, oke, ngwere, na nnụnụ.

translation.en: The secret to their success is the concept of the niche, a special job each cat holds that keeps it from competing with others.
translation.ig: Ihe nzuzo nke ọganihu ha bụ gburugburu ebe obibi, ọrụ nwamba niile ji nke na egbochi ịsọmpi ha na ndị ọzọ.

translation.en: Lions are the most social cats, living in large groups called prides.
translation.ig: Ọdụm bụ nwamba kachasị emekọrịta n'onwe ha, na-ebi na nnukwu òtù akpọrọ nganga.

translation.en: Prides are made up of one to three related adult males, along with as many as thirty females and cubs.
translation.ig: Mpako gasị bụ otu ruo atọ ụmụ nwoke tozuru oke metụtaranụ mejupụtara ya, yana ụmụ nwanyị na ụmụ ya dị ọtụtụ dị ka iri atọ.

translation.en: The females are usually closely related to each other, being a large family of sisters and daughters.
translation.ig: Ndị nwanyị na-emetụtakarị nke ukwu n’onwe ha, n’ibu otu nnukwu ezinụlọ nke ụmụnne nwanyị na ụmụ nwa nwanyị.

translation.en: Lion prides act much like packs of wolves or dogs, animals surprisingly similar to lions (but not other big cats) in behavior, and also very deadly to their prey.
translation.ig: Ezinụlọ Ọdụm na-akpa agwa ka ezinụlọ oke nkịta ọhịa maọbụ nkịta ụlọ, anụ ndị nwere oyiyi dị ịtụ n'anya nye Ọdụm (mana odịghị otu a n'ebe nnukwu nwamba ndị ọzọ nọ) n'omume, ma bụrụ ihe oke iyi egwu nye ihe ọbụla ha na-achụ na nta.

translation.en: A well rounded athlete, the tiger can climb (though not well), swim, leap great distances and pull with five times the force of a strong human.
translation.ig: Ome ihe egwuregwu zuruoke nkeoma, agu ahu ga enyili elu (obu ezie na obughi nkeoma), gwuo mmiri, maa-amaa garuo ebe di oke anya ma doo okpukpu ise dika ike mmadu di ike nwere ike ido.

translation.en: The tiger is in the same group (Genus Panthera) as lions, leopards, and jaguars. These four cats are the only ones who can roar.
translation.ig: Agụ nọ n’otu otu (Genus Panthera) dika ọdụm, owuru, na jaguar. Nwamba anọ ndị a bụ naanị ndị nwere ike ime mbigbọ.

translation.en: The tiger's roar is not like the full-voiced roar of a lion, but more like a sentence of snarly, shouted words.
translation.ig: Ụja agụ adịghị ka mgbọpụta n'uju ụja ọdụm, mana ọ dị nnọọ ka okwu e kwuputara n'iti mkpu.

translation.en: Ocelots like to eat small animals. They will catch monkeys, snakes, rodents and birds if they can. Almost all of the animals that the ocelot hunts are far smaller than it is.
translation.ig: Ona amasi Ocelot iri obere umu-anumanu. Ha ga anwuchi enwe, agwo, oke na nnunu ma ha nwee ike. Oka-na-onuogugu anu anumanu nile Ocelot na achu-nta di obere nnukwu karia ka odi.

translation.en: Scientists think that ocelots follow and find animals to eat (prey) by smell, sniffing for where they've been on the ground.
translation.ig: Ndị oke mmụta sayensị cheere na nwamba Oselọt ji isi esochi ma na-achọta anụ ha ga eri, site na ịkpọkwa imi n'ala iji site ebe ha gara.

translation.en: They can see very well in the dark with night vision, and move very stealthily, too. Ocelots hunt their prey by blending in with their surroundings then pouncing on their prey.
translation.ig: Ha na-ahụ ụzọ nke ọma n'abalị, ma na ejegharịkwa na nzuzo karịa. Oselọotụ na agwakọta onwe ha na gburugburu ha iji nwude anụ ha na achụ.

translation.en: When a small group of living things (a small population) gets separated from the main population that they came from (like if they move over a mountain range or a river, or if they move to a new island so that they can't easily move back) they will often find themselves in a different environment than they were in before.
translation.ig: Mgbe ọbụla ụmụ obere ihe dị ndụ (obere ọnụ ọgụgụ yiri onwe ha) si na ndị otu ha pụọ (dịka ha gafee ugwu, osimiri, maọbụ gaa n'agwaetiti ọzọ ebe ọ ga-ara ahụ isi laghachi) ha ga-achọta onwe ha na gburugburu di iche ọtụtụ mgbe.

translation.en: This new environment has different resources and different competitors, so the new population will need different features or adaptations to be a strong competitor than what they had needed before.
translation.ig: Gburugburu ọhụrụ a nwere akụrụngwa dị iche ma ndị ịsọmpi dị iche, n'ihi nke a ọnụọgụgụ ọhụrụ ahụ kwesịrị inwe akụrụngwa dị iche maọbụ ihe mmegharị ọzọ ga eme ya ka ọbụrụ onye ịsọmpi dị ike karịa ka ọdịbu.

translation.en: The original population hasn't changed at all, they still need the same adaptations as before.
translation.ig: Ọnụọgụgụ nke izizi agbanwebeghị maọlị, ha ka chọrọ ihe mmegharị dịka nke mgbe mbụ.

translation.en: Over time, as the new population begins to adapt to their new environment, they start to look less and less like the other population.
translation.ig: Ka oge na-aga, dịka gburugburu ha ọhụrụ bidoro mawa ha ahụ, oyiyi ha na ndị ha hapụrụ ebido na-ebelata.

translation.en: Eventually, after thousands or even millions of years, the two populations will look so different that they can't be called the same species.
translation.ig: Mgbe puku afọ maọbụ rịị nde afọ ụfọdụ gasịrị, otu abụọ a ga adị nnọọ iche ruo oke ebe agaghịzị akpọ ha abụọ otu ụdị.

translation.en: We call this process speciation, which just means the formation of new species. Speciation is an unavoidable consequence and a very important part of evolution.
translation.ig: Anyi na-akpọ usoro a speciation, nke pụtara nguzobe nke ụdị okike ọhụụ. Speciation bụ nsonaazụ a na-apụghị ịgbagha agbagha na akụkụ dị oke mkpa nke evolushọn.

translation.en: Plants make oxygen which humans breathe, and they take in carbon-dioxide which humans exhale (that is, breathe out).
translation.ig: Osisi na-eme ikuku oksigin nke mmadụ na-ekuru, ma ha na e kubanye carbon-dioxide nke mmadụ na-ekufu ume (ya bụ, na-ekufu ume).

translation.en: Plants make their food from the sun by photosynthesis. They also provide shade.
translation.ig: Akụmakụ osisi na emepụta nri nke ha site n’anyanwụ site n’aka fotosintesis. Ha na-enyekwa ndo.

translation.en: We make our houses from plants and make clothes from plants. Most foods that we eat are plants. Without plants, animals could not survive.
translation.ig: Anyị ji osisi eme ụlọ na akwa. Ọtụtụ nri anyị na-eri bụ osisi. Ewepụ osisi, anụmanụ agaghị adị ndụ.

translation.en: Mosasaurus was the apex predator of its time, so it feared nothing, except other mosasaurs.
translation.ig: Mosasaurus bụbu isi n'anụ na-eri anụ n’oge ya, nke a mere na onweghi ihe na-atụ ya egwu, karịa mosasaurs ibe ya.

translation.en: Its long jaws were studded with more than 70 razor-sharp teeth, along with an extra set in the roof of its mouth, meaning that there was no escape for anything that crossed its path.
translation.ig: Agba ogologo ya bụ nke emejupụtara n'iji ihe karịrị eze dị aguba-nkọ iri asaa, yana òtú òtù mmezi n'elu ọnụ ya, nke pụtara na ọ nweghị ụzọ mgbapụ maka ihe ọ bụla gafere n'ụzọ ya.

translation.en: We don't know for sure, but it may have had a forked tongue. Its diet included turtles, large fish, other mosasaurs, and it may even have been a cannibal.
translation.ig: Onweghị anyị anya, mana ọ dịka onwere ire abụọ. Ọ na eri mbe mmiri, nnukwu azụ, anụ ndị yiri ya, onwekwara ike na eri ụdị nke ya.

translation.en: It also attacked anything that entered the water; even a giant dinosaur such as T. rex would be no match for it.
translation.ig: Ọ wakpọkwara ihe ọ bụla banyere n’ime mmiri ahụ; ọbụná nnukwu dainosọọ dị ka T. rex abụghị atụ n’ebe ọ nọ.

translation.en: While most of their food would be familiar to us, Romans did have their share of strange or unusual feast items, including wild boar, peacock, snails, and a type of rodent called a dormouse
translation.ig: Ka anyị maara nke ọma imirikiti nri ha, ndị Rom nwere oke ha na ihe erimeeri ijuanya ma ọ bụ pụrụ iche, gụnyere ezi ọhịa, piikọkụ, ejula, na ụdị oke akpọrọ dormouse.

translation.en: Another difference was that while the poor people and the woman ate their food while sitting in chairs, the rich men liked to have banquets together where they would lounge on their sides while they ate their meals.
translation.ig: Ihe ọzọ dị iche bụ na ebe ndị ogbenye na nwanyị ahụ riri nri ha ka ha nọ ọdụ n'oche, ndị ọgaranya na-enwe mmasị inwe mmemme oriri ebe ha ga-eri nke ha n'ezumike.

translation.en: Ancient Roman meals couldn't have included foods that came to Europe from America or from Asia in later centuries.
translation.ig: Ụmụ nri Ndị Rome Ndị mgbe ochie enwughị ike ịgụnye nri ndị batara Yurop site na Amerịka ma ọ bụ Eshịa na narị afọ ndị na-esotenu.

translation.en: For instance, they didn't have corn, nor tomatoes, nor potatoes, nor cocoa, and no ancient Roman ever tasted a turkey.
translation.ig: Na imaatu, ha enweghi oka, nweghi tomato, nweghi poteto, nweghi koko, na onweghi onye Rome mgbeochie deturu anu toro-toro ire.

translation.en: The Babylonians built each of their gods a primary temple that was considered the home of the god.
translation.ig: Ndị Babịlọn rụrụ otu n’ime chi ha otu isi ụlọ nsọ nke e were ka ebe obibi chi ahụ.

translation.en: People would bring sacrifices to the gods and the priests would try to attend to the needs of the gods through ceremonies and festivals.
translation.ig: Ebe ndị mmadụ wetaara chi ndị ahụ aja, ndị nchụ aja ahụ maka ihe ha bụ chi na-achọ, site n'emume na mmemme di iche iche.

translation.en: Each temple had an open temple courtyard and then an inner sanctuary that only the priests could enter.
translation.ig: Ulo-uka n’otu n’otu nwere mbara-ezi ulo-uka ma nwekazie ime ebe nchuaja ebe nani onye-isi nchu-aja nwere-ike ibanye.

translation.en: Sometimes special pyramid shaped towers, called ziggurats, were built to be a part of the temples.
translation.ig: Ụfọdụ oge a na arụnye ụlọ elu nwere oyiyi oiramid, ndị akpọrọ ziggurats, ka ha bụrụ osonye ụlọ okpukpe.

translation.en: The top of the tower was special sanctuary for the god.
translation.ig: Elu ụlọ elu a bụ ebe dị nsọ pụrụ iche nye chi ahụ.

translation.en: In the warm climate of the Middle East, the house was not so important.
translation.ig: Na ekpem-oku nke udidi na mba ndi etiti owuwa-anyanwu, ulo ahu abachaghi uru.

translation.en: Most of the life of the Hebrew family happened in the open air.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ ihe ezinụlọ ndị juu a mere, ọ bụ n'anya onye ọbụla ka ha mere ya.

translation.en: Women did the cooking in the yard; stores were just open counters looking into the street. Stone was used for building houses.
translation.ig: Ụmụ nwanyị siri nri na mbara eze; ụmụ ụlọ ahịa wụbụ naanị ọgụego mepere emepe na-elefe anya n'okporo ámá. E jire okwute maka ịrụ ụlọ.

translation.en: There were no large forests in the land of Canaan, so wood was extremely expensive.
translation.ig: O nweghị ụmụ ọhịa buru ibu n’ala nke Keenan, ya mere osisi na-ada oke ọnụ.

translation.en: Greenland was settled sparsely. In the Norse sagas they say that Erik the Red was exiled from Iceland for murder, and when travelling further west, found Greenland and named it Greenland.
translation.ig: Ndị mmadụ anọjughị otu ebe na Grinland. N'akụkọ Norse ha sị na achụfuru Erik the Red n'obodo Iceland n'ihi igbu ọchụ, ma mgbe ọ na aga njem na mgbada ọdịda anyanwụ, ọchọpụtara Grinland wee gụọ ya Grinland.

translation.en: But regardless of his discovery, Eskimo tribes were already living there at the time.
translation.ig: Mana n'agbanyeghi nchọpụta ya, agbụrụ Ezkimo ebirilarị ebe ahụ n'oge ahụ.

translation.en: Though each country was 'Scandinavian', there were many differences between the people, kings, customs and history of Denmark, Sweden, Norway and Iceland.
translation.ig: N'agbanyeghị na obodo ọbụla bụ 'mba Skandinevia', enwere ọtụtụ ihe dị iche n'etiti ndị, ndị eze, omenala, na akụkọ ihe mere na Denmak, Swiden, Nọọwe na Aisland.

translation.en: If you have watched the movie National Treasure, you may think a treasure map was written on the back of the Declaration of Independence.
translation.ig: Ọ bụrụ na ileela ihe nkiri a na-akpọ Akụ nke Mba, i nwere ike chee na e dere otu maapụ akụ n'azụ nke Nkwupụta nke Nnwere Onwe ahụ.

translation.en: However, that is not true. Although there is something written on the back of the document, it is not a treasure map.
translation.ig: Agbanyeghị, nke ahụ abụghị eziokwu. N’agbanyeghị na enwere ihe edere n’azụ nke dọkumentị ahụ, ọ bụghị otu maapụ akụ.

translation.en: Written on the back of the Declaration of Independence were the words "Original Declaration of Independence dated 4th July 1776". The text appears on the bottom of the document, upside down.
translation.ig: Ka-edere na azu nkwuputa nke nnoro-onwe bu okwua “Nkwuputa nke Nnoro-onwe Nke bu ezie ubochi abali 4 juli 1776” .Ederede ahu putara na ala-ala akwukwo ahu, kpodo isi na-ala.

translation.en: While no one knows for certain who wrote it, it is known that early in its life, the large parchment document (it measures 29¾ inches by 24½ inches) was rolled up for storage.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ ezie na ọnweghị onye maara nke ọma onye dere ya, amaara na mmalite na ndụ ya, afụkọtara nnukwu dọkụment e jiri akpụkpọ anụ mee (o nwere nha inchì 29¾ site na inchì 24½) ọnụ maka nchekwa.

translation.en: So, it is likely that the notation was added simply as a label.
translation.ig: Ya mere, ọ dị ka agbakwụnyere ihe ngosi a dị ka akara njirimara naanị.

translation.en: The D-Day landings and the following battles had freed the north of France, but the south still wasn't free.
translation.ig: Ubochi-ubochi nladata ya agha ndi na esota atohapula mpaghara ugwu nke France, mana mpaghara ndida enwerebekwa onwe ha.

translation.en: It was ruled by the "Vichy" French. These were French people who had made peace with the Germans in 1940 and worked with the invaders instead of fighting them.
translation.ig: Ndị chịrị ya bụ ndị "Vichy" French. Ndị a bụ ndị mba Frans ndị ha na ndị mba Jamini mere udo n'afọ 1940 ma soro ndị iro rụkọọ ọrụ karịa ịlụso ha ọgụ.

translation.en: On 15 August 1940, the Allies invaded southern France, the invasion was called "Operation Dragoon".
translation.ig: N'ụbọchị nke iri na ise nke ọnwa Ọgọọstụ n'afọ 1940, ndị enyi busoro mpaghara ndịda nke Frans agha, akpọrọ nke a "Operation Dragoon".

translation.en: In just two weeks the Americans and Free French forces had liberated southern France and were turning towards Germany.
translation.ig: N'ime nanị izu abụọ ndị agha America na Ndị French nke Nweere onwe ha emeela ka ndịda France nwere onwe ha ma wee na-atụgharị echewe ihu na Germany.

translation.en: A civilization is a singular culture shared by a significant large group of people who live and work co-operatively, a society.
translation.ig: Ọdịnala bụ otu omenaala ọha mmadụ buru ibu na-ebi ma na-arụkọ ọrụ ọnụ, a na-akpọ ọha mmadụ a sosayiti.

translation.en: The word civilization comes from the Latin civilis, meaning civil, related to the Latin civis, meaning citizen, and civitas, meaning city or city-state, and that also somehow defines the size of the society.
translation.ig: Ahịrịokwu "civilization" si n'okwu Latin bụ civilis, nke pụtara "gbasara obodo", nke metụtara okwu Latin bụ civis, nke pụtara onye obodo, na civitas, nke pụtara obodo maọbụ obodo-steeti, nke ahụ nwekwara otu o si egosi nha nke ọha mmadụ.

translation.en: City-states are the precursors of nations. A civilizational culture implies the passing on of knowledge across several generations, a lingering cultural footprint and fair dissemination.
translation.ig: Steeti-obodo gasị bụ obu ụzọ nke ụmụ mba. Omenaala kemmepeanya pụtara nnyefe nke ihe ọmụma n'etiti ọtụtụ ọgbọ, akaraụkwụ omenaala nke ka nọ ya na mgbasa dịtụ mma.

translation.en: Minor cultures often vanish without leaving relevant historic evidence and fail to be recognized as proper civilizations.
translation.ig: Ụmụ obere ọdịnala na-apụ n'anya na-ahapụghị ihe akaebe dị mkpa ya mere anaghị ahụta ha dị ka sivilaịzeshọn kwesịrị ekwesị.

translation.en: During the Revolutionary War, the thirteen states first formed a weak central government—with the Congress being its only component—under the Articles of Confederation.
translation.ig: Ka a na alụ agha ntụgharị, steeti iri na atọ ahụ bu ụzọ gbakọọ bido gọọmenti nchịkọta nke na adịghị ike - nke nzukọ bụ sọ ngalaba onwere- n'okpuru akwụkwọ obodo.

translation.en: Congress lacked any power to impose taxes, and, because there was no national executive or judiciary, it relied on state authorities, who were often uncooperative, to enforce all its acts.
translation.ig: Nzukọ enweghị ike ike ụtụ ma n'ihi na enweghi ndị isi ọchịchị gọọmenti etiti maọbụ ndị omeiwu, ọ dabeere na ndị isi ọchịchị steeti, ndị anaghị enwe otu obi ọtụtụ oge ịkwado iwu ya nile.

translation.en: It also had no authority to override tax laws and tariffs between states.
translation.ig: O nweghi ikike imechi iwu ụtụisi na tarifu n'etiti steeti na steeti.

translation.en: The Articles required unanimous consent from all the states before they could be amended and states took the central government so lightly that their representatives were often absent.
translation.ig: Ederede ahụ chọrọ nkweta steeti niile n'enweghi mgbagha tupu enwee ike imezi ha ma steeti ga weere gọọmentị etiti n'ihe efu ruo na ndị nnọchiteanya ha anaghị abịa.

translation.en: Italy's national football, along with German national football team is the second most successful team in the world and were the FIFA World Cup champions in 2006.
translation.ig: Ndị otu egwuregwu bọọlụ ukwu nke mba Itali, ya na ndị otu egwuregwu bọọlụ ukw nke mba Jamani bu ndị kacha eme nke ọma n'otu bọọlụ ukwu na mbaụwa ma bụrụkwa ndị nwetara mmeri n’iko mbaụwa nke afo 2006.

translation.en: Popular sports include football, basketball, volleyball, water-polo, fencing, rugby, cycling, ice hockey, roller hockey and F1 motor racing.
translation.ig: Egwuregwu ndị a ma ama gụnyere futbọl, basketbọl, volleybọl, polo-mmiri, fencing, rugby, ịgba ịnyịnya, hockey ice, hockey roller na ịgba ọsọ ụgbọ ala F1.

translation.en: Winter sports are most popular in the Northern regions, with Italians competing in international games and Olympic events.
translation.ig: Egwuregwu oge oyi kachasị ewu ewu n'ugwu, ebe ndị mba Italy so asọ mpi n'egwuregwu mba na mba makwa na Olimpik.

translation.en: Japans holds nearly 7,000 islands (the biggest being Honshu), making Japan the 7th largest island in the world!
translation.ig: Mba Japan nwere isuo ruru nde asaa (nke kachasị ibu bụ isuo Honshu), nke a mere mba Japan isuo nke asaa kacha ibu n'ụwa.

translation.en: Due to the cluster/group of islands Japan has, Japan is often referred to, on a geographical stance, as an "archipelago"
translation.ig: N’ihi mkọkụlọta/òtù agwaetiti ahụ Japan nwere, a na-arụnyekarị Japan aka, n’elu etu ala ndị ahụ sị guzogide, dị ka "archipelago"

translation.en: Taiwan beginning start way back in 15th century where European sailors passing by record the island’s name as Ilha Formosa, or beautiful island.
translation.ig: Mbido mmepe Taịwan malitere n’oge gara aga nke narị afọ iri na ise mgbe ndị ọkwụ ụgbọ mmiri Ndị Yurop na-agafe dekọrọ aha agwaetiti ahụ dị ka Ilha Formosa, ma ọ bụ agwaetiti mara mma.

translation.en: In 1624,Dutch East India Company establishes a base in southwestern Taiwan, initiating a transformation in aboriginal grain production practices and employing Chinese laborers to work on its rice and sugar plantations.
translation.ig: N'afọ 1624, Ụlọọrụ Dọch Isti Indịa mepere ụlọọrụ na ndịda ọdịdaanyanwụ Taịwan, bido mgbanwe n'otu e si emepụta mkpụrụ n'oge gboo, ma wee ndị ọkpọkọọrụ Chaịna ka ha rụọ ọrụ n'ugbo osikapa na nke shuga ha.

translation.en: In 1683, Qing dynasty (1644-1912) forces take control of Taiwan’s western and northern coastal areas and declared Taiwan as a province of the Qing Empire in 1885.
translation.ig: N'afọ 1683, ndị agha ezinụlọ ọchịchị Shịng (1644-1912) weghaara akụkụ mmiri Taịwan dị n'ọdịda anyanwụ na nke dị n'ugwu ma kwuputa na Taịwan bụzi mpaghara n'okpuru ọchịchị Alaeze Shịng n'afọ 1885.

translation.en: In 1895, after defeat in the First Sino-Japanese War (1894-1895), the Qing government signs the Treaty of Shimonoseki, by which it cedes sovereignty over Taiwan to Japan, which rules the island until 1945.
translation.ig: Na 1895, mgbe a dachara n’Agha Sino-Japanese Mbụ (1894-1895), ọchịchị Qing ahụ mere mbịanye aka na Nkwekọrịta nke Shimonoseki ahụ, site na nke o jiri nyefee Japan ọbụbụeze nke Taiwan, nke na-achị agwaetiti ahụ ruo 1945.

translation.en: Machu Picchu consist of three main structures, namely Intihuatana, the Temple of the Sun, and the Room of the Three Windows.
translation.ig: Machu Picchu nwere ọdịdị atọ, ya bụ Intihuatana, Ụlọ Nsọ nke Anyanwu, yana Ime ụlọ nke Windo Atọ.

translation.en: Most of the buildings on the edges of the complex have been rebuilt in order to give tourists a better idea of how they originally appeared.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ n'ime ụlọ ndị nọ na mpụta ogige ụlọ ahụ ka arụgharịrị ka enwee ike gosi ndị njem nleta echiche etu ha siri pụta na mbụ.

translation.en: By 1976, thirty percent of Machu Picchu had been restored and restoration continues till today.
translation.ig: Mgbe 1976 ruru, e mezigharịala pasent iri atọ nke Machu Pichu; mmezi a ka na-aga n'ihu ruo taa.

translation.en: For example, the most common still image photography format in the world is 35mm, which was the dominant film size at the close of the analog film era.
translation.ig: Dịka ọmụmaatụ, nhàzi nka osise onyinyo nkwụ n'otu ebe a na-ahụkarị n'ụwa niile bụ 35mm, nke bụ nha fim kachasị ewu ewu na ngwụcha oge fim analọgụ.

translation.en: It is still produced today, but more importantly its aspect ratio has been inherited by digital camera image sensor formats.
translation.ig: A ka na-emepụta ya taa, mana ihe ka mkpa bụ na ụdịdị sensọ foto nke igwefoto dijital eketala aspekt reshiyo ya.

translation.en: The 35mm format is actually, somewhat confusingly, 36mm in width by 24mm in height.
translation.ig: Ọ dịtụ mgbagwoju anya na, n'ezie, ụdịdị 35mm nwere 36mm n'obosara na 24mm n'ogo.

translation.en: The aspect ratio of this format (dividing by twelve to obtain the simplest whole-number ratio) is therefore said to be 3:2.
translation.ig: akuku rashio nke usoro a ( iji iri na-abuo were nweta rashio onu ogugu dikasiri mfe) bu 3:2 maka nke a.

translation.en: Many common formats (APS family of formats, for example) are equal to or closely approximate this aspect ratio.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ usoro nkịtị (dịka usoro APS si n'otu ezinaụlọ) ga-abụ otu ihe maọbụ ruo ihe dịka nkepụta nkewa a.

translation.en: The much-abused and often-ridiculed rule of thirds is a simple guideline creating dynamism while keeping a measure of order in an image.
translation.ig: Iwu nke atọ ndị a na-akparị ma na-akwakarị oke emu bụ usoro dị mfe na-emepụta ịdịmgbanwò dị ka ọ na-edotekwa otu ụhara usoro ọrụ n'ime otu onyinyo.

translation.en: It states that the most effective place for the main subject is at the intersection of lines dividing the image into thirds vertically and horizontally (see example).
translation.ig: O kwuru na ebe kachasị dị ire maka isi nke isiokwu bụ na mmekọta ụmụ ahịrị na-ekebi ụmụ onyinyo ahụ n’ụzọ atọ na nke eguzoro ọtọ nakwa nke a mara afọ n’ala (hụ ọmụmatụ).

translation.en: During this period of European history, the Catholic Church, which had become rich and powerful, came under scrutiny.
translation.ig: N'oge a na Yurop, e bidoro lebawa anya n'Ụka Katọlik, nke bagoro ụba ma dị ike.

translation.en: For over a thousand years the Christian religion had bound European states together despite differences in language and customs. I
translation.ig: Kamgbe ihe karịrị otu puku afọ, okpukpe Ndị Kraịst jikọtara obodo ndị dị na Yuropu n'agbanyeghị na asụsụ na omenala ha dịgasị iche.

translation.en: Its all-pervading power affected everyone from king to commoner.
translation.ig: Ike ya juputara ebe niile metụtara onye ọbụla site n'eze ruo na mmadụ nkịtị.

translation.en: One of the main Christian tenets is that wealth should be used to alleviate suffering and poverty and that the monetary funds of the church are there specifically for that reason.
translation.ig: Otu n'ime isi okwu okwukwe Ndị Kristian bu na ekwesiri iji akụ belata nhụjuanya na ịda ogbenye nakwa na ego ụka nọ kpọmkwem ebe ahụ n'ihi nke ahụ.

translation.en: The central authority of the church had been in Rome for over a thousand years and this concentration of power and money led many to question whether this tenet was being met.
translation.ig: Ikike keetiti ahụ nke ụlọ uka anọọla n'ime Rom karịa otu puku afọ ma mkpọkọnata ike na ego a duru ọtụtụ ndị ịjụ sị ma a na-esokwa ụkpụrụ ya.

translation.en: Soon after the outbreak of hostilities, Britain initiated a naval blockade of Germany.
translation.ig: Ka agha dara, mba Britenị jiri ndị agha elu mmiri gbochie ndị Jamani inweta enyemaka

translation.en: The strategy proved effective, cutting off vital military and civilian supplies, although this blockade violated generally accepted international law codified by several international agreements of the past two centuries.
translation.ig: Atụmatụ ahụ rụrụ ọrụ ọfụma, na-ebepụ ụmụ ihe mbute ihe ndị agha na ndị nkiti dị oke mpka, n’agbanyeghị na mgbochi a dara iwu mba ụwa anabatara n’izugbe nke ọtụtụ nkwekọrịta n’etiti mba ụwa nke afọ narị abụọ gara aga nyere ikikere.

translation.en: Britain mined international waters to prevent any ships from entering entire sections of ocean, causing danger to even neutral ships.
translation.ig: Briten tinyere ogbunigwe na mmiri ọha mba igbochi ụgbọ mmiri ọbụla ịbata, nke a abụrụ ihe ize ndụ nye ụgbọ mmiri ndị esoghi alụ agha.

translation.en: Since there was limited response to this tactic, Germany expected a similar response to its unrestricted submarine warfare.
translation.ig: Ebe nzaghachi ihe omume a pere mpe, mba Jamini lere anya na a ga emekwa otu ihe n'ebe agha okpuru mmiri nọ.

translation.en: During the 1920s, the prevailing attitudes of most citizens and nations was that of pacifism and isolation.
translation.ig: N'oge afọ ndi 1920, agwa kachasị dị ebe nile n'etiti ndị mba dị iche iche bụ nke ịchọ udo na nnọrọ onwe.

translation.en: After seeing the horrors and atrocities of war during World War I, nations desired to avoid such a situation again in the future.
translation.ig: Mgbe a hụchara ụmụ egwu na ajọ ọmụme nke agha n’oge Agha Ụwa I, mba gasị chọrọ izere ụdị ọnọdụ ahụ ọzọ n’ọdịnihu.

translation.en: In 1884, Tesla moved to the United States of America to accept a job with the Edison Company in New York City.
translation.ig: N'afọ 1884, Tesla kwagara na mba Amerịka ịnara ọrụ na nke Ụlọ ọrụ Edison n'Obodo Niu Yọk.

translation.en: He arrived in the US with 4 cents to his name, a book of poetry, and a letter of recommendation from Charles Batchelor (his manager in his previous job) to Thomas Edison.
translation.ig: Ọ bịarutere na US n’inwe centị anọ n’aha ya, otu akwụkwọ nke uri, ya na otu akwụkwọ ozi nke nkwanye sitere na Charles Batchelor (onye njikwa ya n’ọrụ ya gara aga) ruo Thomas Edison.

translation.en: Ancient China had a unique way of showing different time periods; each stage of China or each family that was in power was a distinctive dynasty.
translation.ig: Chaịna ndị mgbe ochie nwere ụzọ pụrụ iche igosi oge afọ; ogo ọbụla nke Chaịna ma ọ bụ ezinụlọ ọ bụla nọbụrụ n’ọchịchị wụbụ oge ọchịchị eze pụrụ iche.

translation.en: Also between each dynasty was an unstable age of divided provinces. The best-known of these periods was the Three Kingdoms epoch taking place for 60 years between the Han and the Jin Dynasty.
translation.ig: Nakwa n’etiti usoro ndị eze ọ bụla bụ otu oge ejighị n'aka mke mpaghara ndị kewara ekewa. Oge ndị a nke a kacha mara amara bụ oge nke Alaeze Atọ nke mere ruo afọ iri na isii n'etiti Usoro Ndị Eze Han na Usoro Ndị Eze Jin ndị ahụ.

translation.en: During these periods fierce warfare took place between many nobles fighting for the throne.
translation.ig: N'oge ndị a, a lụrụ ọtụtụ agha n'etiti ndi ukwu na-azọ oche eze.

translation.en: The Three Kingdoms was one of the bloodiest eras in Ancient China’s history thousands of people died fighting to sit in the highest seat in the grand palace at Xi’an.
translation.ig: Alaeze Atọ so n'otu n'ime ọgbọ kacha dị egwu n'akụkọ ihe mere na mba Chaịna mgbe gboo. Puku kwuru puku mmadụ nwụrụ n'agha ịnọ n'oche ọchịchị nke kachasị elu na nnukwu obi eze nke dị na Xi'an.

translation.en: There are a lot of social and political effects such as the use of metric system, a shift from absolutism to republicanism, nationalism and the belief the country belongs to the people not to one sole ruler.
translation.ig: Nke a butere ọtụtụ mmetụta na mmekọ mmadụ na ibe ya makwa na ndọrọ ndọrọ ọchịchị dika usoro agụm ọnụ, mgbanwe site n'ọchịchị okwu otu onye gaa na nke okwu mba, nke obodo na nkwenye na obodo bụ nke ọha karịa ịbụ nke otu onye ọchịchị.

translation.en: Also after the Revolution occupations were open to all male applicants allowing the most ambitious and successful to succeed.
translation.ig: Ọzọkwa mgbe ụmụ aka ọrụ Mgbanwe ọchịchị ahụ mepechara maka ụmụ nwoke ọchọ ọrụ niile na-ekwe ka ndị kacha nwee oké ọchịchọ na ihe ịga nke ọma ka ha gaa nke ọma.

translation.en: Same goes for the military because instead of army rankings being based on class they were now based on cailaber.
translation.ig: Ọ bụkwa otu ihe ahụ n'amị, maka na kama nhazi n'usoro nke ndị amị ga-adabere n'ogugo, ọ daberezie n'ikikere.

translation.en: The French Revolution also inspired many other repressed working class people of other country's to began their own revolutions.
translation.ig: Mgbanwe France melitere obi ndi oru ana emegbu emegbu no gasi na mba ndi ozo ha ewere wee ike ibido mgbanwe nke ha.

translation.en: Muhammad was deeply interested in matters beyond this mundane life. He used to frequent a cave that became known as “Hira‘” on the Mountain of “Noor” (light) for contemplation.
translation.ig: Muhammad nwere ezigbo mmasị n’ụmụ okwu gabigara ụwa a na-agwụ ike. Ọ dịbụ na-agakarị n’otu nnukwu ọnụala nke emechara mara dị ka “Hira‘” n’ugwu nke “Noor” (light) maka ntụgharị ụche.

translation.en: he cave itself, which survived the times, gives a very vivid image of Muhammad’s spiritual inclinations.
translation.ig: ọgba ahụ n'onwe ya, nke lanarịrị oge ndị a, na-enye ezigbo ihe ngosi maka echiche gbasara ihe mmụọ nke Muhammad.

translation.en: Resting on the top of one of the mountains north of Mecca, the cave is completely isolated from the rest of the world.
translation.ig: Na-ezu ike n’elu otu n’ime ugwu ndị nọ n’uwgu nke Meeka, nnukwu ọnụala dịpụrụ adịpụ n’ozuzu site n’akụkụ ụwa ndị ọzọ niile

translation.en: In fact, it is not easy to find at all even if one knew it existed. Once inside the cave, it is a total isolation.
translation.ig: N'ezie, ọ dịghị mfe maọlị ịchọta, ọbụrụgodi na mmadụ maara na ọ dị. Ozugbo abanyere n'ime ọgba ahụ, ọ bụ ndịpụ kpam kpam.

translation.en: Nothing can be seen other than the clear, beautiful sky above and the many surrounding mountains. Very little of this world can be seen or heard from inside the cave.
translation.ig: O nweghị ihe ọzọ enwere ike ịhụ na-abụghị eluigwe dị n’elu gbachapụrụ, maa mma na ọtụtụ ugwu gbara gburugburu. Nanị obere nke ụwa ka enwere ike ịhụ ma ọ bụ nụ site n’ime nnukwu ọnụala ahụ.

translation.en: The Great Pyramid at Giza is the only one of the seven wonders that is still standing today.
translation.ig: Oke Piramid na Giza bụ naanị nke ka kwụ taa n'ime ihe itụnanya asaa ahụ.

translation.en: Built by the Egyptians in the third century BCE, the Great Pyramid is one of many large pyramid structures built to honor dead Pharaoh.
translation.ig: Ndị Ijipt rụrụ n’ime narị afọ atọ BCE, Oke Piramidi ahụ otu n’ime ọtụtụ nnukwu ihe ọwụwụ piramidi arụrụ ịkwanye Fero nwụrụ ugwu.

translation.en: The Giza Plateau, or "Giza Necropolis" in the Egyptian Valley of the Dead contains several pyramids (of which the great pyramid is the largest), several small tombs, several temples, and the great Sphinx.
translation.ig: Ala ugwu Giza maọbụ "Giza Nekropolis" nke dị na ndagwurugwu ọnwụ Ijipt nwere ọtụtụ piramid (nke piramid ukwu bụ nke kachasị ibu), ọtụtụ ebe olili, ọtụtụ ụlọ ofufe nakwa oke Sfinks.

translation.en: The great pyramid was created to honor the Pharaoh Khufu, and many of the smaller pyramids, tombs, and temples were built to honor Khufu's wives and family members.
translation.ig: Arụrụ oke piramid iji kwanyere Eze Khufu zugwu, ya na ọtụtụ piramid obere ndị ọzọ, ebe olili na ụlọ ofufe arụrụ ịkwanyere ndị inyom Khufu na ezinụlọ ya ugwu.

translation.en: The "up bow" mark looks like a V and the "down bow mark" like a staple or a square missing its bottom side.
translation.ig: Akara “ụta elu” ahụ yiri otu V ma akara “ụta ala” ahụ yiri otu stepụlụ ma ọ bụ otu ǹkomgbaànoǹhà nke tufure ebe okpuru ya.

translation.en: Up means you should start at the tip and push the bow, and down means you should start at the frog (which is where your hand is holding the bow) and pull the bow.
translation.ig: Elu pụtara na Ị kwesịrị isi n'ọnụnụ ya pịa ụta aka, ma ala pụtara na Ị kwesịrị isi na fụrọgụ (nke bụ ebe aka gị ji ụta) were dọọ ụta aka.

translation.en: An up-bow usually generates a softer sound, while a down-bow is stronger and more assertive.
translation.ig: Otu ụta-elu na -emepụtakarị ụda kara dị nro, ebe ụta-ala ka sie ike ma kara kwupụta.

translation.en: Feel free to pencil in your own marks, but remember the printed bowing marks are there for a musical reason, so they should usually be respected.
translation.ig: Detuo akara nke gị na nwere onwe, mana chetakwa na akara ndị ahụ ebiri ebi nwere uru egwu ha bara, n'ihi nke a ha kwesịrị ka akwanyere ha ugwu.

translation.en: The terrified King Louis XVI, Queen Marie Antoinette their two young children (11 year old Marie Therese and four year old Louis-Charles) and the King's sister, Madam Elizabeth, on the 6th October 1789 were forced back to Paris from Versailles by a mob of market women.
translation.ig: N'Oktoba 6, 1789, ụmụ nwanyị ahịa iwe ji yiri Eze Luwi XVI oke egwu mgbe ha si na Versailles dọrọ ya, nwunye ya Marịa Antwanet, obere ụmụ ha abụọ (Marịa Teriza dị afọ 11 na Luwi-Chals dị afọ anọ), na nwanne nwanyị Eze, Madam Elizabet, dọghachi ha na Parii.

translation.en: In a carriage, they traveled back to Paris surrounded by a mob of people screaming and shouting threats against the King and Queen.
translation.ig: Ha laghachiri Paris n'ime moto ịnyịnya ndị iwe na-ewe gbara gburugburu, ha na-eti mkpu na-agwa Eze na Nwunye ya ihe egwu dị iche iche.

translation.en: The mob of people forced the King And Queen to have their carriage windows wide open.
translation.ig: Ndị iwe a manyere Eze na Queen ka ha meghee windo ụgbọ ha.

translation.en: At one point a member of the mob waved the head of a royal guard killed at Versailles in front of the terrified Queen.
translation.ig: N'otu mgbe otu n'ime ndị igwe mmadụ fegharịrị isi onye nche eze egburu na Versailles n'ihu eze nwanyi ụjọ ji.

translation.en: The war expenditures of U.S. imperialism in the conquest of the Philippines were paid for by the Filipino people themselves.
translation.ig: Mmefu ego n'agha nke ndị Amerịka mbịarachịwa na mmeri ndị Filipaị bụ nke ndị Filipino kwụrụ ụgwọ ya n’onwe ha.

translation.en: They were compelled to pay taxes to the U.S. colonial regime to defray a major part of the expenditures and the interest on bonds floated in the name of the Philippine government through the Wall Street banking houses.
translation.ig: A manyere ha iwu ịkwụ ụtụisi nye ndị ọchịchị mbịarachịwa mba Amerịka iji wedata oke ego e mefuru n'aha gọọmenti mba Filipin site n'aka ụlọakụ Wọlụ Striti.

translation.en: Of course, the superprofits derived from the protracted exploitation of the Filipino people would constitute the basic gains of U.S. imperialism.
translation.ig: N’eziokwu, nnukwu uru e nwetara na ogologo mmegbu ndị mba Filipiinụ ga-abụ ihe mejuputara isi uru omume empaya Amerịka.

translation.en: To understand the Templars one must understand the context that prompted the creation of the order.
translation.ig: Ịghọta ndị Templars, aghaghi ịghọta ọnọdụ nke kpaliri okike nke otu a.

translation.en: The age where the events took place is commonly referred as the High Middle Ages the period of European history in the 11th, 12th, and 13th centuries (AD 1000–1300).
translation.ig: Ọgbọ ihe ndị a mere na ya ka a na-akpọkarị Ọgbọ Etiti dị Elu bụ oge ihe ndị mere na mba Yuropu n'afọ narị iri na otu, narị iri na abụọ na narị iri na atọ (AD 1000-1300).

translation.en: The High Middle Ages were preceded by the Early Middle Ages and followed by the Late Middle Ages, which by convention ends around 1500.
translation.ig: Ọgbọ etiti ndị nke mbụ butere ọgbọ etiti ndị dị elu ụzọ, nke ọgbọ etiti nke ngwụcha sotere n'azụ nke gwuru ebe 1500.

translation.en: Technological determinism is a term that encompasses a wide range of ideas in practice, from technology-push or the technological imperative to a strict sense that human destiny is driven by an underlying logic associated with scientific laws and their manifestation in technology.
translation.ig: Mkpebi teknụụzụ bụ usoro gazuru nchịkọta nchepụta gasị etinyere n’uju, site na technụụzụ-kwàa maọbụ nye iwu siri ike nke bụ na njedebe nke onye ga-esite n’iwu metụtara sayensi na nke ngosipụta teknụụzụ.

translation.en: Most interpretations of technological determinism share two general ideas: that the development of technology itself follows a path largely beyond cultural or political influence, and that technology in turn has "effects" on societies that are inherent, rather than socially conditioned.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ nkọwa e nyere nkwenyesiike kenkanụzụ nwere echiche izugbe abụọ: na mmepụta nkanụzụ n'onwe ya na-agbaso usoro nke gbapụrụ iche site na nkwanye nke omenala maọbụ ndọrọndọrọ ọchịchị, ya na kwa na nkanụzụ n'aka nke ya nwere "mmekpaahụ" ọ na-enye ọhaobodo nke dị adị, n'abụghị nke sitere na mmekọrịta.

translation.en: For example, one might say that the motor car necessarily leads to the development of roads.
translation.ig: Maka ọmụmaatụ, mmadụ nwere ike ịsị na ụgbọala n'ịkwesị ekwesị na-eduga na mmepe nke ụzọ gasị.

translation.en: However, a nationwide road network is not economically viable for just a handful of cars, so new methods of production are developed to reduce the cost of car ownership.
translation.ig: N'agbanyeghị nke a, okporo ụzọ zuru obodo ọnụ bụ mmefu ego ma ọbụrụ na ụgbọ ala ehighị nne, ya mere emepụtara ụzọ ọhụrụ ịwedata ego o na ewe inwe ụgbọala.

translation.en: Mass car ownership also leads to a higher incidence of accidents on the roads, which leads to the invention of new techniques in healthcare for repairing damaged bodies.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ mmadụ inwe ụgbọ ala na-ebutekwa nnukwu ihe mberede n'okporo ụzọ, nke na-eweta mmepụta usoro nleta ahụike ọhụrụ maka ịrụzi ahụ mebiri emebi.

translation.en: Romanticism had a large element of cultural determinism, drawn from writers such as Goethe, Fichte, and Schlegel.
translation.ig: Ihunanya ya nwere otutu ihe banyere mmeme nke ọdịnala, nke sitere n'aka ndị edemede dịka Goethe, Fichte, na Schlegel.

translation.en: In the context of Romanticism, the geography molded individuals, and over time customs and culture related to that geography arose, and these, being in harmony with the place of the society, were better than arbitrarily imposed laws.
translation.ig: Na onodu romanticism, ala ebe onye no bu ihe na kpu omume mmadu, k’oge na aga odinala na omenala metutara ala ebe obibi amalite, nkea mere ndi mmadu jiri nabata odinala na omenala ndia maka na ha na ya bu odinala na omenala nwere nkwekorita karia iwu ana atukwasa n’isi oha.

translation.en: In the manner that Paris is known as the fashion capital of the contemporary world, Constantinople was regarded as the fashion capital of feudal Europe.
translation.ig: N'otu aka a maara Paris ka isi ejiji ịchọ mma n'ụwa nke oge a, e weere Kọnstantinopul dịka isi ejiji ịchọ mma na mba Yuropu n'oge agha.

translation.en: Its renown for being an epicenter of luxury began in about 400 A.D. and lasted up until about 1100 A.D.
translation.ig: Ebidoro n’afo 400A.D. ruo n’afo 1100 A.D were mara ya na o bu isi mkporindu.

translation.en: Its status declined during the twelfth century mainly due to the fact that Crusaders had returned bearing gifts such as silks and spices that were valued more than what Byzantine markets offered.
translation.ig: Ọkwa na gbadara n’oge narị afọ iri na abụọ tụmadị n’ihi eziokwu bụ na Ndị agha ntute alaghachila ma bute ụmụ onyinye dị ka ụmụ akwa sịlk na ngwa nri ndị nwere mbamuru karịrị ihe ahịa Byzantine nyere.

translation.en: It was at this time that the transfer of the title of Fashion Capital from Constantinople to Paris was made.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ n'oge ahụ ka okwa isi ejiji ịchọ ma siri na Kọnstantinopul fere Paris.

translation.en: Gothic style peaked in the period between the 10th - 11th centuries and the 14th century.
translation.ig: Usoro Gotik kasị elu n'oge dị n'etiti afọ ndị nari nke ir na narị nke iri na otu ya na narị nke iri na anọ.

translation.en: At the beginning dress was heavily influenced by the Byzantine culture in the east.
translation.ig: Na mbido, ọ bụ usoro ejiji ndị Byzantium n'ọwụwa anyanwụ ka onye ọbụla na-eso.

translation.en: However, due to the slow communication channels, styles in the west could lag behind by 25 to 30 year.
translation.ig: Mana, n'ihi ụkpụrụ mkparịta ụka na adịghị ọsịsọ, usoro dị na ọdịda anyanwụ nwere ike inọzụga azụ n'oteaka afọ iri abụọ na ise ruo iri atọ.

translation.en: towards the end of the Middle Ages western Europe began to develop their own style. one of the biggest developments of the time as a result of the crusades people began to use buttons to fasten clothing.
translation.ig: na njedebe nke oge Mịdụl Eeji ndị ọdịda anyanwụ Europe malitere mepụtawa usoro nke ha. Otu ihe mmepụta kachasi mkpa n'oge ahụ, n'ihi ọgụ aghara, ndị mmadụ bidoro iji bọtịnụ akpọchị akwa.

translation.en: Subsistence agriculture is agriculture carried out for the production of enough food to meet just the needs of the agriculturalist and his/her family.
translation.ig: Ugbo oru bu ihe oru ugbo bu nke eweputara iji meputa nri ga ezuru ndi mmadu choro ya ma obu ya na ulo ya.

translation.en: Subsistence agriculture is a simple, often organic, system using saved seed native to the ecoregion combined with crop rotation or other relatively simple techniques to maximize yield.
translation.ig: Ịkọ ọrụ ugbo bụ ihe dịcha mfe, ọtụtụ mgbe nke ndụ, sistèm n'iji nkpụrụ echekwara bụ nwa afọ na mphaghara ebe obibi ahụ ejikọtara ya na nghagharị mkpụrụ ma ọ bụ usoro ndị ọzọ dị mfe iji mee ka ọmịmị kachasị.

translation.en: Historically most farmers were engaged in subsistence agriculture and this is still the case in many developing nations.
translation.ig: Na mgbe gboo ọtụtụ n'ime ndị na-akọ ugbo na-eme ụdị nke onwe n'enweghị nke orire ọ ka dịkwa otu a n'ọtụtụ obodo ka na etolite etolite.

translation.en: Subcultures bring together like-minded individuals who feel neglected by societal standards and allow them to develop a sense of identity.
translation.ig: Obere omenaala na-ekpọkọta ọnụ ndị nwere ụdị echiche ndị nwere mmetụta na ụkpụrụ keobodo ha leghaara ha anya ma nye ha ohere ịzụlite echiche nke njirimara.

translation.en: Subcultures can be distinctive because of the age, ethnicity, class, location, and/or gender of the members.
translation.ig: Enwere ike imata ngalaba omenala site na afo, agburu, klaasi, ebe onye bi, ma o bu etu chukwu si kee mmadu -i bu nwoke ka ibu nwanyi.

translation.en: The qualities that determine a subculture as distinct may be linguistic, aesthetic, religious, political, sexual, geographical, or a combination of factors.
translation.ig: Ihe nlereanya aji ama na omenala pụrụ iche bụ asụsụ, ịchọ mma, okpukpe, ọchịchị, mmekọahụ, ọnọdụ ebe, maọbu njikọ ọtụtụ ihe.

translation.en: Members of a subculture often signal their membership through a distinctive and symbolic use of style, which includes fashions, mannerisms, and argot.
translation.ig: Ndịòtù nke otu okpuru omenala na-akpọtụrụkarị ịdị n'òtù ha site n'otu ojiji akanka pụrụ iche ma dịmara, nke gụnyere ụmụ ejiji, omume, na asụsụ ịgba izu.

translation.en: One of the most common methods used to illustrate the importance of socialization is to draw upon the few unfortunate cases of children who were, through neglect, misfortune, or wilful abuse, not socialized by adults while they were growing up.
translation.ig: Otu n’ime ukpuru akacha mara nke atuzi-aka banyere uru di mmekorita bu iweta n’uche ihe nwute banyere umu-aka ndi elefuuru-anya, na-nwuta, maobu mmeto akpachaara-anya mee, enweghi mmekorita ha ndi toro-eto mgbe ha ka na-eto eto.

translation.en: Such children are called "feral" or wild. Some feral children have been confined by people (usually their own parents); in some cases this child abandonment was due to the parents' rejection of a child's severe intellectual or physical impairment.
translation.ig: Ụdị ụmụaka a ka a na akpọ ndị azụghị azụ. Ọtụtụ ụmụaka an na azụghị azụ abụrụla ndị ndị mmadụ jituru ejitu (ọ na abụkarị ndị mụrụ ha); oge ụfọdụ ngharịpụ ụmụaka bụ maka ọjụjụ ntụpọ dị na ahụ nwatakịrị ahụ a na ahụ anya maọbụ ntụpọ dị n' akọ n'uche ya.

translation.en: Feral children may have experienced severe child abuse or trauma before being abandoned or running away.
translation.ig: Ụmụaka azụghịazụ nwere ike ha e nweela ahụmihe nke mmetọ ụmụaka ma ọ bụ ahụmihe mkpasasị uche nke ukwuu tupu agbahapụ ha ma ọ bụ ha na-agbalaga.

translation.en: Others are alleged to have been brought up by animals; some are said to have lived in the wild on their own.
translation.ig: Ndị ọzọ bụ ebubo ka eboro n’ọbụ ụmụ anụmanụ kpọpụtara ha; a sịkwara n’ụfọdụ biri n’ime ọhịa na onwe ha.

translation.en: When completely brought up by non-human animals, the feral child exhibits behaviors (within physical limits) almost entirely like those of the particular care-animal, such as its fear of or indifference to humans.
translation.ig: Mgbe anumanu na-abughi-mmadu zulitechara ya kpam-kpam, nwa-ohia ahu egosi akparama-agwa (na njedebe ebe ana ahu anya) ihe dika nani nke anumanu-nlekota ya, dika ujo ya nye maobu enweghi ujo nye umu mmadu.

translation.en: While project based learning should make learning easier and more interesting, scaffolding goes a step beyond.
translation.ig: Dịka ọmụmụ dabere n’arụmarụ kwesịrị ime ka ọmụmụ kara dị mfe ma na-adọkwu mmasị, ịkụ skafoldu gakwuru otu ụzọụkwụ n’ihu.

translation.en: Scaffolding is not a method of learning but rather an aid that provides support to individuals whom are undergoing a new learning experience such as using a new computer program or beginning a new project.
translation.ig: Skafoldin abụghị usoro mmụta kama ọ bụ enyemaka na-akwado ndị na-amụ ihe ọhụrụ dịka iji program ọhụrụ arụ ọrụ na kọmputa maọbụ ibido ọrụ ọhụrụ

translation.en: Scaffolds can be both virtual and real, in other words, a teacher is a form of scaffold but so is the little paperclip man in Microsoft Office.
translation.ig: Ụmụ arụrụmarụ osisi nwere ike ịbụ ma kendịnuche ma ịdịrị ire, n'ụzọ ọzọ, onye nkuzi bụ ụdị arụrụmarụ osisi mana ọ dịkwa dị ka nwoke ntakịrị mkpado akwụkwọ n'ime Microsoft Office.

translation.en: Virtual Scaffolds are internalized in the software and are meant to question, prompt, and explain procedures that may have been to challenging for the student to handle alone.
translation.ig: A rụnyechara Ihe nkwado n'ime ngwanro a, ndị ga-ajụ ajụjụ, nye ozi, ma kọwaa usoro ndị gaara ara nwa akwụkwọ ahụ ịghọta n'onwe ya.

translation.en: Children are placed in Foster Care for a wide variety of reasons that range from neglect, to abuse, and even to extortion.
translation.ig: Enwere ọtụtụ ihe e ji akpọga ụmụ aka ka onye ọzọ lekọta ha, dịka nleghara anya, mmegbu, nakwa nnapụ ihe.

translation.en: No child should ever have to grow up in an environment that is not nurturing, caring, and educational, but they do.
translation.ig: Ọ dị mma ka nwatakịrị tolite na gburugburu ebe a na-adịghị elekọta, elekọta, na agụmakwụkwọ, mana ha na-eme ya.

translation.en: We perceive the Foster Care System to be a safety zone for these children.
translation.ig: Anyị na-ahụta Ụkpụrụ Nlekọta anya ahụ ka ebe n’enweghi ihe iyi ndụ egwu nye ụmụaka ndị a.

translation.en: Our foster care system is supposed to provide safe homes, loving caregivers, stable education, and reliable health care.
translation.ig: Ụlọ nchekwa ụmụaka anyị kwesịrị inye ụlọ nwere nchekwa, ndị nledo anya nwere ịhụnanya, nkụzi akwụkwọ dị mma, na nlekọta ahụike dị ntụkwasịobi.

translation.en: Foster care is supposed to provide all the necessities that were lacking in the home they were previously taken from.
translation.ig: Ulo nlekọta anya ndi akpotara-akpota kwesiri inyecha ihe nile di mkpa nke na adighi n’ulo ochie esi na kpota ha.

translation.en: The Internet combines elements of both mass and interpersonal communication.
translation.ig: Ịntanetị na-ejikọ akụkụ nke nkwukọrịta ọha na nkwukọrịta nke mmadụ abụọ.

translation.en: The distinct characteristics of the Internet lead to additional dimensions in terms of the uses and gratifications approach.
translation.ig: Njirimara pụrụ iche nke Ịntaneetị na-eduga akụkụ agbakwụnyere n’usoro nke ojiji ya na usoro afọ ojuju.

translation.en: For example, “learning” and “socialization” are suggested as important motivations for Internet use (James et al., 1995).
translation.ig: Maka ọmụmaatụ, “mmụta” na “mkpakọrịta” bụ ndị atụnyere dịka mkpalite dị mkpa maka ojiji Ịntanetị (James na ndị ọzọ., 1995).

translation.en: “Personal involvement” and “continuing relationships” were also identified as new motivation aspects by Eighmey and McCord (1998) when they investigated audience reactions to websites.
translation.ig: Eighmey na McCord(1998) chọpụtara na “nsonye” na “mmekọrịta ga-adịgịde” sokwa na ihe mkpali ọhụrụ mgbe ha nyochara mmeghachi omume ndị na-abịa n'ọtụtụ webụsaịtị.

translation.en: The use of video recording has led to important discoveries in the interpretation of micro-expressions, facial movements which last a few milliseconds.
translation.ig: Ojiji nke ndekọ vidio edugawo na ụmụ nchọpụta dị mkpa n’ime nkọwa nke nzipụta-n’ihu-kentakịrị, mmegharị ihu nke na-anọru milisekọnd ole na ole.

translation.en: In particular, it is claimed that one can detect whether a person is lying by interpreting micro-expressions correctly.
translation.ig: Akachasị ekwu na mmadụ nwere ike ịma mmgbe mmadụ na atụ asi ma ọbụrụ na onwere ike ịkọwapụta obere mmegharị ahụ dị iche iche ọfụma.

translation.en: Oliver Sacks, in his paper The President's Speech, indicated how people who are unable to understand speech because of brain damage are nevertheless able to assess sincerity accurately.
translation.ig: Oliver Saks, n'akwụkwọ ya Okwu Onyeisi Obodo, gosiri ka ndị enweghị ike ịghọta ọnụ okwu n'ihi isi mmebi nwere ike ikwu mgbe mmadụ na-ekwu eziokwu.

translation.en: He even suggests that such abilities in interpreting human behavior may be shared by animals such as domestic dogs.
translation.ig: Ọ na-ekwu rịị na ikekwe ụmụ anụmanụ dịka nkịta ụlọ nwekwara ụdịrị ikikere a ịghọta omume mmadụ

translation.en: Twentieth century research has shown that there are two pools of genetic variation: hidden and expressed.
translation.ig: Nnyocha na narị afọ nke iri abụọ egosipụtala na enwere ụdịrị genetik variyeshọn abụọ: nke zoro ezo na nke pụtara apụta.

translation.en: Mutation adds new genetic variation, and selection removes it from the pool of expressed variation.
translation.ig: Mgbanwe n'ọdịdị na-agbakwunye ọdịdị kejenetiki ọhụrụ, ma nhọpụta na-ewepụ ya n'ogwu ọdịdị nke a kọwapụtara.

translation.en: Segregation and recombination shuffle variation back and forth between the two pools with each generation.
translation.ig: Nkewa na ntughari nkpokorita nkeghari na azu n'etiti ọdọ mmiri abua ahu na ọgbọ o bula.

translation.en: Out on the savanna, it is hard for a primate with a digestive system like that of humans to satisfy its amino-acid requirements from available plant resources.
translation.ig: N'ime savanna, ọ bụ ihe siri ike na primate nwere usoro nri dị ka nke mmadụ iji mejupụta amino-acid chọrọ site na ihe ọkụkụ dịnụ.

translation.en: Moreover, failure to do so has serious consequences: growth depression, malnutrition, and ultimately death.
translation.ig: Ọzọ dịka ibe ya, ị jụ ime ihe a nwere nnukwu ntaramahụhụ: nnukwu ndamụmbà, ọtịtaahụ, nakwa ọnwụ n'ikpeazụ.

translation.en: The most readily accessible plant resources would have been the proteins accessible in leaves and legumes, but these are hard for primates like us to digest unless they are cooked.
translation.ig: Ihe akụrụngwa a na-enweta ngwa ngwa ga-abụrịrị protein ndị dị na akwụkwọ na legume gasị, mana ihe ndị a siri ike maka ndị nyiri mmadụ ndịọzọ bị n’ọhịa dịka anyị iji gbazèe ma anyị sie ya n’ọkụ.

translation.en: In contrast, animal foods (ants, termites, eggs) not only are easily digestible, but they provide high-quantity proteins that contain all the essential amino acids.
translation.ig: N’aka ọzọ, nri anụmanụ arụrụ, ntanta, akwa) abughi naani di nfe, kama ha na-enye oke protein nke nwere amino acid nile di nma.

translation.en: All things considered, we should not be surprised if our own ancestors solved their "protein problem" in somewhat the same way that chimps on the savanna do today.
translation.ig: Eleghị anya, ya atụla anyị n'anya ma ọbụrụ na ndị nna nna anyi ji aka ha gboo "mkpa protin" ha n'usoro dị ka nke enwe bi n'ọhịa si eme taa.

translation.en: Sleep interruption is the process of purposefully awakening during your normal sleep period and falling asleep a short time later (10–60 minutes).
translation.ig: Nkwụsịtụ ụra bụ usoro nke ịkpacharanya eteta ụra mgbe oge ị na-ehikarị ụra ma na-ada n’ụra mgbe obere oge gachara (nkeji 10–60).

translation.en: This can be easily done by using a relatively quiet alarm clock to bring you to consciousness without fully waking you.
translation.ig: Enwere ike ime ka n’uzo mfe site na iweta atanu ogbu-opi uzu ya dikariri nwayo ikpobata gi na uche kama ghara ikpotecha gi na-ozuzuoke.

translation.en: If you find yourself resetting the clock in your sleep, it can be placed on the other side of the room, forcing you to get out of bed to turn it off.
