translation.ig: Ọ bụrụ na ị hụtara onwe gị na-ewubergharị elekere gị n’ime nrọ gị, e nwere ike idobe ya n’akụkụ nke ọzọ nke ime ụlọ ahụ, na-amanye gị isi n’akwa bilie ịgbanyụ ya.

translation.en: Other biorhythm-based options involve drinking lots of fluid (particularly water or tea, a known diuretic) prior to sleep, forcing one to get up to urinate.
translation.ig: Ụzọ biorhythm ndị ọzọ gụnyere ịñụ oke ihe mmiri (karịsịa mmiri maọbụ tii, dayuretik a maara amaara) tupu arahụ ụra, na-amanye mmadụ ibili maka ịnyụ amịrị.

translation.en: The amount of inner peace a person possesses correlates oppositely to the amount of tension in one’s body and spirit.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ ole udo nke obi mmadụ nwere na-emekọrịta na nchịkọta ihu na ole obimgbalielu nọ n'ime ahụ na mmụọ nke mmadụ.

translation.en: The lower the tension, the more positive the life force present. Every person has the potential to find absolute peace and contentment.
translation.ig: Ka a na-ewetulata esemokwu ahụ, ka ike ndụ nọ ugbu a na-adịkwuo mma. Mmadu niile nwere ike mmepụta ịchọta udo zuru oke na afọ ojuju.

translation.en: Everyone can achieve enlightenment. The only thing standing in the way of this goal is our own tension and negativity.
translation.ig: Mmadụ nile nwere ike ịma ihe. Sọ ohe nọchiri ụzọ bụ ekweghị ekwe nke anyi na ụjọ.

translation.en: The Tibetan Buddhism is based on the teachings of Buddha, but were extended by the mahayana path of love and by a lot of techniques from Indian Yoga.
translation.ig: Buddhism ndị Tibet dabere n’ụmụ nkuzi nke Buddha, mana adọtịkwuru ha site n’aka ụzọ nke ihụnanya mahayana ya na site n’aka ọtụtụ usoro si na Yoga Indịa.

translation.en: In principle the Tibetan Buddhism is very simple. It consists of Kundalini Yoga, meditation and the path of all-embracing love.
translation.ig: Na ntọala, Buddhism Tibet dị ezigbo mfe. Ọ mejupụtara Yoga Kundalini, ntụgharị uche na ụzọ nke ịhụnanya nnabata-ihe niile.

translation.en: With Kundalini Yoga the Kundalini energy (enlightenment energy) is awakened through yoga postures, breathing exercises, mantras and visualizations.
translation.ig: N’iji Yoga Kundalini ike Kundalini (ike mmepe anya) bụ nke etetara site n’ụmụ postchọ yoga, mgbatị ahụ iku ume, ukwe ntụgharị uche na ihe ngosi.

translation.en: The center of Tibetan meditation is the Deity Yoga. Through the visualization of various deities the energy channels are cleaned, the chakras are activated and the enlightenment consciousness is created.
translation.ig: Nke bụ isiokwu ntụgharị uche nke ndị Tibet bụ Deyiti Yoga. Site na ichepụta chi dị iche iche, a na ehichapụta ụkpụrụ ike, kpọghee chakra ma kepụta owuweanya nke amamihe.

translation.en: Germany was a common enemy in World War 2, leading to cooperation between the USSR and USA. With the end of the war the clashes of system, process and culture led to the countries falling out.
translation.ig: Jamini bụ ndị iro ọha n'Agha Ụwa nke abụọ, nke mere mba USA na USSR ji nwee mmekọ. Ka agha gwụrụ, esemokwu usoro omume, na omenala mere mba ndị ahụ ji nwee okwu.

translation.en: With two years of the end of the war, the former allies were now enemies and the Cold War began.
translation.ig: N'etiti afọ abụọ nke nlụcha nke agha ahụ, ndị mba bụbu ndị mmekọrịta bụzi ndị iro ugbu a ma Agha Oyi ahụ bidokwara.

translation.en: It was to last for the next 40 years and would be fought for real, by proxy armies, on battlefields from Africa to Asia, in Afghanistan, Cuba and many other places.
translation.ig: O kwesịrị ịnọru ruo afọ iri anọ na-abịa abịa ma a ga-alụkwa ya n'ezie, site n'aka ụsụụ ndị agha nnọchite, n'ama agha site n'Afrịka ruo Eshia, n'ime Afghanistan, Kiuba na ọtụtụ ebe ndị ọzọ.

translation.en: By September 17, 1939, the Polish defense was already broken, and the only hope was to retreat and reorganise along the Romanian bridgehead.
translation.ig: Mgbe Septemba 17, 1939 ruru, a kutuola nchekwa ndị Poland; naanị olileanya ha nwere bụ ịlaghachi tụọ atụmatụ ọzọ n'akụkụ isi briij Romenia.

translation.en: However, these plans were rendered obsolete nearly overnight, when over 800,000 soldiers from the Soviet's Union Red Army entered and created the Belarussian and Ukrainian fronts after invading the eastern regions of Poland in violation of the Riga Peace Treaty, the Soviet-Polish Non-Aggression Pact, and other international treaties, both bilateral and multilateral.
translation.ig: Mana, o gbughi oge ka atụmatụ a niile laa n'efu, mgbe ihe karịrị ndị Sọviet Yunịọn Red Amị 800,000 banyere, kepụta ogige agha ndị Belarụs na Yukren, ka ha wakpochara akụkụ ọwụwa anyanwụ Poland na nnupu isi nye Nkwekọrịta Udo Riga, Nkwekọrịta Udo Sọviet Yunịọn na Poland, na ọtụtụ nkwekọrịta ndị ọzọ, ma nke dị n'etiti mba abụọ, na nke dị n'etiti ọtụtụ mba.

translation.en: Using ships to transport goods is by far the most efficient way to move large amounts of people and goods across oceans.
translation.ig: Iji ụgbọ mmiri ebughari ngwa ahịa bụ ụzọ kachasị mma n'ezie iji buru ọtụtụ ndị na ọtụtụ ngwa gafee oke osimiri.

translation.en: The job of navies has traditionally been to ensure that your country maintains the ability to move your people and goods, while at the same time, interfering with your enemy's ability to move his people and goods.
translation.ig: Ọrụ nke ndị agha nke mmiri abụrụla kemgbe ịgba mbọ hụ na mba gị jidesiri ike ikikere ibugharị ndị gị na ngwaahịa gị, ma n'otu mgbe ahụ, na-egbochi ikikere onye iro gị ibugharị ndị ya na ngwaahịa ya.

translation.en: One of the most noteworthy recent examples of this was the North Atlantic campaign of WWII. The Americans were trying to move men and materials across the Atlantic Ocean to help Britain.
translation.ig: Otu n’ime ọmụmatụ oge na-etebeghị anya nke a kacha tozuo oke bụbu kampeenụ Ugwu Atlantik nke WWII. Ndị Amerịka nọ na-anwa ibugharị ụmụ nwoke na ngwongwo gafee Oke osimiri Atlantik inyere Britenụ aka.

translation.en: At the same time, the German navy, using mainly U-boats, was trying to stop this traffic.
translation.ig: N'otu mgbe ahụ, ndị agha nke mmiri nke Jamanị, n'iji naanị ụgbọokpurummiri, nọ na-agbalị ịkwụsị mkpọchi ụzọ a.

translation.en: Had the Allies failed, Germany probably would have been able to conquer Britain as it had the rest of Europe.
translation.ig: Ọ bụrụ na ndị mba bụbu ndị mmekọrịta dara, Jamanị nwere ike eleghi anya merie Briten dị ka o mere Yurop ndị ọzọ fọdụrụ.

translation.en: Goats seem to have been first domesticated roughly 10,000 years ago in the Zagros Mountains of Iran.
translation.ig: Ewu yiri ka e buru ụzọ mee ya anụụlọ n’ihe ruru puku afọ iri gara aga n'ugwu Zagros nke Iran.

translation.en: Ancient cultures and tribes began to keep them for easy access to milk, hair, meat, and skins.
translation.ig: Omenala ndị mgbe ochie na agbụrụ bidoro iji dobe ha maka inweta ohere dị mfe na mmiri ara, ntutu isi, anụ, na anụahụ gasị.

translation.en: Domestic goats were generally kept in herds that wandered on hills or other grazing areas, often tended by goatherds who were frequently children or adolescents, similar to the more widely known shepherd. These methods of herding are still used today.
translation.ig: E dobere n'ozuzu ụmụ ehu ụlọ n'ime ìgwè ndị nke pagharịrị n'elu ugwu ma ọ bụ ebe ịta ahịhịa ndị ọzọ, nke ọtụtụ mgbe bụ ndị ọzụzụ ehu na-elekọta ha ndị nke na abụkarị ụmụaka ma ọ bụ ụmụ ntorọbịa, nke yiri onye ọzụzụ atụrụ a ka mara ama. A ka na-eji usoro ọzụzụ ehu ndị a ruo taa.

translation.en: Wagonways were built in England as early as the 16th Century.
translation.ig: E wuru ụzọ ụgbọ ibu gasị n’Ingland dị ka n'oge dị ka narị afọ nke iri na isii ahụ.

translation.en: Although wagonways merely consisted of parallel planks of wood, they allowed horses pulling them to achieve greater speeds and pull larger loads than on the slightly more rough roads of the day.
translation.ig: Agbanyeghị ụmụ ụzọwagọn nwere naanị ogwe osisi nọ n’akụkụ n’akụkụ, ha nyere ụmụ ịnyịnya na-esere ha òhèrè irute ekwomọsọ ndị karịrị ma sere ibu kara dị ukwuu karịa n’ụmụ ụzọ nke ụbọchị ahụ ndị karịtụrụ dị ike ike.

translation.en: Crossties were introduced fairly early to hold the tracks in place. Gradually, however, it was realised that tracks would be more efficient if they had a stip of iron on the top.
translation.ig: Ebidoro mgbe gboo were krọstaị na-arụ ụzọ ụgbọoloko ka o were gbasie ike. Obere obere a bịa mata na ụzọ ụgbọoloko ga-esikarị ike ma ọ bụrụ na o nweturu obere igwe n’elu ya.

translation.en: This became common practice, but the iron caused more wear on the wooden wheels of the wagons.
translation.ig: Nke mechara bụrụ omume a na-emekarị, mana igwe ahụ kpatakwuru ndọwa n'ụkwụ ụmụ ụgbọ ibu ejiri osisi mee.

translation.en: Eventually, wooden wheels were replaced by iron wheels. In 1767, the first full-iron rails were introduced.
translation.ig: N'ikpeazụ, eji wiil ígwè dochie wiil osisi. N'afọ 1767, e wepụtara wiil nke mbụ ejị igwe rụọ kpam kpam.

translation.en: The first known transportation was walking, humans began walking upright two million years ago with the emergence of Homo Erectus (meaning upright man).
translation.ig: Usoro njem e bu ụzọ mara ama bụ ịga ije, ụmụ mmadụ bidoro ịkwụ ọtọ aga ije afọ nde abụọ gara aga site na mpụta nke Homo Erektus (nke pụtara nwoke kwụ ọtọ).

translation.en: Their predecessors, the Australopithecus did not walk upright as habitually.
translation.ig: Ndị bụ ha ụzọ, Ọstralopitekus ahụ akwụghị ọtọ gaa ije dị ka n'akparamagwa.

translation.en: Bipedal specializations are found in Australopithecus fossils from 4.2-3.9 million years ago, although Sahelanthropus may have walked on two legs as early as seven million years ago.
translation.ig: Achoputara ọkachamara bipedal na fosil Australopithecus site na nde nde afọ 4.2-3.9 gara aga, o bu ezie na Sahelanthropus nwere ike ije ije n'ukwu abuo na nde afọ asaa gara aga.

translation.en: We can start living more friendly to the environment, we can join to the environmental movement, and we can even be activists in order to reduce the future suffering in some degree.
translation.ig: Anyị nwere ike malite ibi n’enyi karịa na gburugburu ebe obibi, anyị nwere ike isonye ije nke gburugburu ebe obibi, ma anyị nwekwara ike ịbụ ndị ọchọ mgbanwe ka e nwee ike belata ntaramahụhụ ọdịnihu ruo ogo ụfọdụ.

translation.en: This is just like symptomatic treatment in many cases. However, if we do not only want a temporary solution, then we should find the root of the problems, and we should deactivate them.
translation.ig: Nke a dị nnọọ ka ọgwụgwọ kemgbaàmà n’ọtụtụ okwu. Agbanyeghị, ọ bụrụ na anyị achọghị naanị ọsịsa nke nwa oge, ya mere anyị kwesịrị ịchọta isi ihe kpatara nsogbu ndị ahụ, ma anyị kwesịrị iwepụ̀ ike ha.

translation.en: It is obvious enough that the world has changed much because of humankind's scientific and technological advancements, and problems have become greater because of overpopulation and mankind's extravagant lifestyle.
translation.ig: O doro anya nke ọma n'ụwa agbanweela nnukwu n'ihi ụmụ ọganihu nke sayensị na teknụzụ nke ụmụ mmadụ, ma ụmụ nsogbu adịla nnukwu karịa n'ihi ọnụọgụgụ mmadụ karịrị akarị na ibifụga ndụ ókè nke ụmụ mmadụ.

translation.en: After its adoption by Congress on July 4, a handwritten draft signed by the President of Congress John Hancock and the Secretary Charles Thomson was then sent a few blocks away to the printing shop of John Dunlap.
translation.ig: Mgbe Kọngres nyechara ya nkwekọrịta ha na Julaị 4, e weere ya n'akwụkwọ eji aka dee, nke Jọn Hankọk Onye isi Kọngres na Chals Tọmsin Onye odeakwụkwọ tinyere akara nkwado ha, wega ya n'ụlọ mbipụta Jọn Dunlap nke eteghi aka.

translation.en: Through the night between 150 and 200 copies were made, now known as "Dunlap broadsides".
translation.ig: N'ime abali n'etiti mbipụta otu narị na iri ise ya na narị abụọ ka e mere, nke a mara ugbu a dị ka “Dunlap broadsides”.

translation.en: The first public reading of the document was by John Nixon in the yard of Independence Hall on July 8.
translation.ig: Oge mbụ a gụpụtara edemede a n'ọha bụ na Julaị 8, nke John Nixn gụrụ na mbaraezi Ụlọọgbakọ Ndipenda.

translation.en: One was sent to George Washington on July 6, who had it read to his troops in New York on July 9. A copy reached London on August 10.
translation.ig: Na Julaị 6, e zigaara George Washington otu kọpị, onye mere ka a gụọrọ ya ndị agha ya na Niu Yọk na Julaị 9. Otu kọpị ruru Lọndọn n'Ọgọstụ 10.

translation.en: The 25 Dunlap broadsides still known to exist are the oldest surviving copies of the document. The original handwritten copy has not survived.
translation.ig: Dunlap brọdsaịd 25 ka nọ taa bụ kọpị edemede izizi ndị kachasị dị ochie. Nke izizi e ji aka dee anọzighi.

translation.en: Many paleontologists today believe that one group of dinosaurs survived and is alive today. We call them birds.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ ndị ọkàchamara ihe banyere fọsịl anụmanụ na osisi taa kwenyere na otu òtù daịnosọọ lanarịrị ma dị ndụ taa. Anyị na-akpọ ha ụmụ nnụnụ.

translation.en: Many people don't think about them as dinosaurs because they have feathers and can fly.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ anaghị eche bayere ha dị ka daịnosọọ n'ihi na ha nwere nku ma nwee ike ife efe.

translation.en: But there are a lot of things about birds that still look like a dinosaur.
translation.ig: Mana a ka nwere ọtụtụ ihe gbasara ụmụ nnụnụ ndị yiri nke daịnosọọ.

translation.en: They have feet with scales and claws, they lay eggs, and they walk on their two back legs like a T-Rex.
translation.ig: Ha nwere okpa ya na abuba na mbu aka, ha na eyi akwa, ha nakwa aga ije na ukwu oji ha abuo dika T-Rex.

translation.en: Virtually all computers in use today are based on the manipulation of information which is coded in the form of binary numbers.
translation.ig: Ihe dịka igwe kọmputa niile e ji arụ ọrụ taa bụ ihe sitere na mkpụrụokwu ndị a gwakọrọ agwakọ nke e tinyere dịka mkpụrụọnụọgụ.

translation.en: A binary number can have only one of two values, i.e. 0 or 1, and these numbers are referred to as binary digits - or bits, to use computer jargon.
translation.ig: Otu akara ọnụọgụ abụọ nwere ike inwe naanị otu n’ime mbamuru abụọ, ya bụ 0 ma ọ bụ 1, ma a na-akpọ akara ndị a dị ka ọnụọgụ keọnụọgụ abụọ - ma ọ bụ bits, iji asụsụ mpụiche kọmputa.

translation.en: Internal poisoning may not be immediately apparent. Symptoms, such as vomiting are sufficiently general that an immediate diagnosis cannot be made.
translation.ig: Ọrịa ịtụ nsị nke ime ahụ nwere ike ọ gaghị adị ire ozigbo. Ihe ngosipụta ya, dịka ọgbụgbọ, bụ ihe ndị na-emekwa n'ọtụtụ ọrịa ndị ọzọ. Ya mere na enweghi ike ịchọpụta ọrịa a ozigbo ozigbo.

translation.en: The best indication of internal poisoning may be the presence of an open container of medication or toxic household chemicals.
translation.ig: Ndosipụta kachasị mma maka inwe ńsí n’ime ahụ nwere ike ịbụ ọnụnọ nke mkpọ ogwụ ghe oghe ma ọ bụ kemikalụ ezinụlọ ndị na-egbu agbu.

translation.en: Check the label for specific first aid instructions for that specific poison.
translation.ig: Lelee nnyeàhà ahụ maka ntụziaka mgbata ọsọ enyemaka mbụ akọwapụtara maka nsi ahụ akọwapụtara.

translation.en: The term bug is used by entomologists in a formal sense for this group of insects.
translation.ig: okwu bụ ahụhụ bụ ndị ọka mmụta ahụhụ n’ụzọ nwere ugwu maka òtù ụmụ ahụhụ a.

translation.en: This term derives from ancient familiarity with Bed-bugs, which are insects highly adapted to parasitize humans.
translation.ig: Okwu a sitere mmarita mgbe-ochie nke akpiri, bu chinchi di oke nko maka ibunye ndi mmadu oria.

translation.en: Both Assassin-bugs and Bed-bugs are nidicolous, adapted to living in nest or housing of their host.
translation.ig: Ma Assassin-bọg na Bed-bọg dị nidikolous, ha zuru oke ibi na nest maọbụ n'ụlọ nke hostu ha.

translation.en: Across the United States of America, there are approximately 400,000 known cases of Multiple Sclerosis (MS), leaving it as the leading neurological disease in younger and middle aged adults.
translation.ig: N'ofe mba Amerịka, e nwere ihe dị ka ọnụọgụ ọrịa Multiple Sclerosis (MS) 400,000 a maara amaara, nke na-eme ya isi ọrịa ụbụrụ na-emetụta ndị ntorọbịa na ndị okenye.

translation.en: MS is a disease that affects the central nervous system, which is made up of the brain, the spinal cord and the optic nerve.
translation.ig: Mọltipụl Sklerosis bụ ọrịa na-emetụta sentral navọs sistem, nke gbakwunyere ụbụrụ, ogwurugwu azụ na ọptik nav.

translation.en: Research has found that females are two times more likely to have MS then males.
translation.ig: Nnyocha achọpụtala na ụmụ nwanyị bụ ihe yikarịrị ugboro abụọ inwe MS karịa ụmụ nwoke.

translation.en: A couple may decide it is not in their best interest, or in the interest of their child, to raise a baby.
translation.ig: Di na nwunye nwere ike ikwekọrịta na ọ gaghị abara ha maọbụ nwa ha uru ịzụpụta nwa.

translation.en: These couples may choose to make an adoption plan for their baby.
translation.ig: Di na nwunye ndị a nwere ike ịhọrọ ime atụmatụ mkpọta nwa maka nwa ha.

translation.en: In an adoption, the birth parents terminate their parental rights so that another couple may parent the child.
translation.ig: N’ime otu mkpọRọ nwa, nne na nna mụrụ nwa ahụ ga-akwụsị ikikere ha dị ka nne na nna ka di na nwunye ọ bụla nwere ike izulite nwa ahụ.

translation.en: Science’s main goal is to figure out the way the world works through the scientific method. This method in fact guides most scientific research.
translation.ig: Isi ọrụ sayensị bụ ịchọpụta otu ụwa si arụ ọrụ site na usoro kesayensị. Usoro n'ezie na-edu ọtụtụ n'ime nnyocha kesayensị.

translation.en: It isn’t alone though, experimentation, and an experiment is a test that is used to eliminate one or more of the possible hypotheses, asking questions, and making observations also guide scientific research.
translation.ig: Ọ nọghị naanị ya n'ezie, eksperimenteshọn, ma otu eksperimenti bụ otu ule nke eji ewepụ otu haịpotesis kwere omume ma ọ bụ karịa, ịjụ ajụjụ gasị, na ime nyochata nakwa eduzi nnyocha sayensị.

translation.en: Naturalists and philosophers focused on classical texts and, in particular, on the Bible in Latin.
translation.ig: Ndị ọkammụta n'ụmụ ihe ekere na ndị ọkachamara gbadoro ụkwụ n'ederede oge gboo, ọkachasị, n'akwụkwọ nsọ e dere na Latin.

translation.en: Accepted were Aristotle's views on all matters of science, including psychology.
translation.ig: A nabatara echiche Aristotle gbasara okwu sayensi niile ma mmuta akparamagwa ya bu psychology

translation.en: As knowledge of Greek declined, the West found itself cut off from its Greek philosophical and scientific roots.
translation.ig: Dika amamihe nke ndi Greek biara gbatuwa, ndi odida anyanwu huta onwe ha ka ha na egbubiri site mgbara-ogwu ndi Greek ha nke ihe-omuma na nka.

translation.en: Many observed rhythms in physiology and behavior often crucially depend on the presence of endogenous cycles and their production through biological clocks.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ usoro a na-ahụ na fisiọlọji na omume na-adabere ọtụtụ mgbe n'usoro ime ahụ na mmepụta ha site n'elekere nke ime ahụ.

translation.en: Periodic rhythms, which are not simply responses to external periodic cues, have been documented for most living beings, including bacteria, fungi, plants, and animals.
translation.ig: Usoro kwa-oge kwa-oge, nke n'abụghị nzaghachi nye ntụpenye kwa-oge keezi, ka edeturula maka ọtụtụ ihe ndị dị ndụ , nke gụnyere nje bakterịa, fọngaị, akụmakụ na ụmụanụmanụ.

translation.en: Biological clocks are self sustaining oscillators which will continue a period of free-running cycling even in the absence of external cues.
translation.ig: Elekere ime ahụ nwere usoro eje alọ nke na-arụ ọrụ n'onwe ya; usoro a ga na-aga n'ihu ma asịgodị rịị na onweghi ihe ọzọ metụtara ya.

translation.en: The Hershey and Chase experiment was one of the leading suggestions that DNA was a genetic material.
translation.ig: Nwale Hershey na Chase so na otu aro no na isi siri na DNA wubu otu mkpụrụ ndụ ihe nketa.

translation.en: Hershey and Chase used phages, or viruses, to implant their own DNA into a bacterium.
translation.ig: Hershey na Chase jiri ụmụ feeji, ma ọ bụ ụmụ nje, iji kụnye DNA nke ha n'ime otu nje bakterịọm.

translation.en: They did two experiments marking either the DNA in the phage with a radioactive phosphorus or the protein of the phage with radioactive sulfur.
translation.ig: Ha mere nnwale abụọ ebe ha ji rediyoaktiv fosforọs kaa akara na DNA nọ na fej maọbụ jiri rediyoaktiv sọlfọ kaa akara na protin nọ na fej.

translation.en: Mutations can have a variety of different effects depending on the type of mutation, the significance of the piece of genetic material affected and whether the cells affected are germ-line cells.
translation.ig: Mgbanwe ọjọọ nwere ike inwe ọtụtụ mmetụta dị iche iche na ndabere na ụdị mgbanwe ọjọọ ọ bụ, abamuru nke otu iberibe nke ihe mkpụrụ ndụ ihe nketa o metụtara na ma ọ bụrụ na ụmụ mkpụrụ ndụ o metụtara bụ ụmụ mkpụrụ ndụ geem-laịnụ.

translation.en: Only mutations in germ-line cells can be passed on to children, while mutations elsewhere can cause cell-death or cancer.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ nanị mgbanwe na mkpụrụ ndụ jem-laịn ka a ga-enyefe ụmụaka, ebe mgbanwe n’ebe ndị ọzọ nwere ike ibute ọnwụ nke mkpụrụ ndụ maọbụ ọrịa kansa.

translation.en: Nature-based tourism attracts people interested in visiting natural areas for the purpose of enjoying the scenery, including plant and animal wildlife.
translation.ig: Njem-nlere anya nke dabere na udidi na enweta uche ndi mmadu ndi nwere mmasi izute ebe di na udidi ha maka ihi ikpori-ndu na udi ebe, gunyekwara akumaku anumanu anu-ohia.

translation.en: Examples of on-site activities include hunting, fishing, photography, bird watching, and visiting parks and studying information about the ecosystem.
translation.ig: Ụfọdụ ihe omume enwere ike ime ma anọrọ ya gụnyere ịchụ nta, ịkụ azụ, ise foto, ilele nnụnụ, na ịga n'ogige gụọ maka ihe ndị dị ndụ na gburugburu ha.

translation.en: An example is visiting, photographing, and learning about organgatuangs in Borneo.
translation.ig: Otu ọmụmaatụ bụ ileta, ise fòto, na ịmụta gbasara na ụmụ ọrangụtanụ nọ n'ime Bọnioo.

translation.en: Every morning, people leave small country towns in cars to go their workplace and are passed by others whose work destination is the place they have just left.
translation.ig: Ututu o bula, ndi mmadu n'ahapu obere obodo n'ugbo ala were gawa ulo oru ha ma ndi ozo n'agbafe ha ndi ulo oru ha di n'ebe ha si puta.

translation.en: In this dynamic transport shuttle everyone is somehow connected with, and supporting, a transport system based on private cars.
translation.ig: N'ime ụgbọ mgbagharị kenjem a na-agbanwegharị agbanwe onye ọ bụla si n'otuọdịla metụta ya, ma na-akwado, otu sistemụ njem dabere na ụgbọala nkeonwe.

translation.en: Science now indicates that this massive carbon economy has dislodged the biosphere from one of its stable states that has supported human evolution for the past two million years.
translation.ig: Sayensị na-egosi ugbu a na ekọnọmi a ji oke kabọn arụ ọrụ akupụla mkpokọta ihe ndụ niile nọ n'ụwa site n'otu n'ime ọnọdụ nkwụsi ike ya nke kwadogoro obibi ndụ mmadụ n'afọ nde abụọ gara aga.

translation.en: Everyone participates in society and uses transportation systems. Almost everyone complains about transportation systems.
translation.ig: Onye ọ bụla na-esonye n'ime ọha mmadụ ma na-eji ụmụ sistemụ njem. Ọ fọrọ obere ka ọ bụrụ onye niile na eme mkpesa gbasara ụmụ sistemụ njem.

translation.en: In developed countries you seldom hear similar levels of complaints about water quality or bridges falling down.
translation.ig: N'ime ụmụ mba mepere emepe ọ ga-ara ahụ tupu ị nụ larịị mkpesa ndị yirinụ gbasara ogo mmiri ma ọ bụ ụmụ akwa mmiri na-ada n'ala.

translation.en: Why do transportation systems engender such complaints, why do they fail on a daily basis? Are transportation engineers just incompetent? Or is something more fundamental going on?
translation.ig: Gịnị mere sistemụ njem ji akpata ụdịrị ụmụ mkpesa ahụ, gịmị mere ha ji ada kwa ụbọchị? Ọ bụ na ndị injinịa njem amaghị arụ ọrụ ha nke ọma? Ma ọ bụ ihe ọzọ si n'isi na-eme?

translation.en: Traffic Flow is the study of the movement of individual drivers and vehicles between two points and the interactions they make with one another.
translation.ig: Ọwụwụ trafik bụ ọmụmụ nke ngagharị nke onye ọkwụ ụgbọ ọ bụla na ụgbọ ha n'etiti akara abụọ na mmekọrịta ha na-eme n'etiti onwe ha.

translation.en: Unfortunately, studying traffic flow is difficult because driver behavior cannot be predicted with one-hundred percent certainty.
translation.ig: Na mwute, ịmụ maka otu okporo njem si aga siri maka na e nweghi ike ikwu kpọm n'ọgụ otu narị pasentị ụdị omume ọkwọ ụgbọ nwere ike ime.

translation.en: Fortunately, drivers tend to behave within a reasonably consistent range; thus, traffic streams tend to have some reasonable consistency and can be roughly represented mathematically.
translation.ig: Ọ dabara nke ọma na ndị na-anya ụgbọ ala nwere usoro omume na-adịgide; ya mere, ụzọ njem moto anaghị agbanwecha agbanwe ma bụrụkwa ihe enwere ike iji eserese aritmetik gosipụta.

translation.en: To better represent traffic flow, relationships have been established between the three main characteristics: (1) flow, (2) density, and (3) velocity.
translation.ig: Iji ka mma na-anọchi anya ije nke okporo ụzọ, E mebewo mmekọrịta n'etiti isi njirimara atọ ahụ: (1) eruba, (2) njupụta, na (3) ike ọsọ.

translation.en: These relationships help in planning, design, and operations of roadway facilities.
translation.ig: Mmetụta ndị a na-enyere aka n’ime atụmatụ, ncheremee, na arụmọrụ nke akụrụngwa okporo ụzọ ụgbọ ígwè.

translation.en: Insects were the first animals to take to the air. Their ability to fly helped them evade enemies more easily and find food and mates more efficiently.
translation.ig: Ụmụ ahụhụ bụ ụmụ anụmanụ buru ụzọ fee n'elu. Ike ha n'ife efe nyere ha aka ịgbanaha ndị iro n'ụzọ kara dị mfe ma ịchọtakwa nri na ndị otu mmekọ n'ụzọ dị werewere.

translation.en: Most insects have the advantage of being able to fold their wings back along the body.
translation.ig: Ihe karịrị ọtụtụ n’ime ụmụ ahụhụ nwere uru nke inwe ike ịpịa nku ha gaa n’ahụ ha.

translation.en: This gives them a wider range of small places to hide from predators.
translation.ig: Nke a na-eme ka ha nwee ọtụtụ ebe izonarị ndị na-eri ha.

translation.en: Today, the only insects that cannot fold back their wings are dragon flies and mayflies.
translation.ig: Ubochi taa, nani ogugu nwere ike ikpalaga nku ya azu bu ogugu drago na ogugu may.

translation.en: Thousands of years ago, a man called Aristarchus said that the Solar System moved around the Sun.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ puku afọ gara aga, otu nwoke a kpọrọ Aristarchus kwuru si na Usoro Mbara Igwe nọ na-agagharị gburugburu Anyanwụ.

translation.en: Some people thought he was right but many people believed the opposite; that the Solar System moved around the Earth, including the Sun (and even the other stars).
translation.ig: Ufodu ndi mmadu chere na ihe o na-ekwu bu eziokwu mana ufodu ekweghi; na mbara igwe na-agba uwa okirikiri ma anyanwu(ma kwa kpakpando ndi ozo)

translation.en: This seems sensible, because the Earth doesn't feel as if it's moving, does it?
translation.ig: Nke a yiri ezi uche, n’ihi na ọ naghị emetụta ka ụwa ọ na-agagharị agagharị, ọ na-emetụta?

translation.en: The Amazon River is the second longest and the biggest river on Earth. It carries more than 8 times as much water as the second biggest river.
translation.ig: Osimiri Amazọn ahụ bụ nke abụọ kachasị ogologo na osimiri kachasị n’ibu n’ụwa. Ọ na-ebu ihe karịrị nha mmiri ugboro asatọ dị ka osimiri nke abụọ kachasị ibu.

translation.en: The Amazon is also the widest river on Earth, at times six miles wide.
translation.ig: Amazọn bụkwa osimiri kachasị saa mbara n'ụwa, mgbe ụfọdụ ọ na-eru maịlụ isii.

translation.en: A full 20 percent of the water that pours out of the planet's rivers into the oceans comes from the Amazon.
translation.ig: Pasentị mmmiri 20 zuru oke nke na-awụpụta site na osimiri ụwa ga na-abanye n'ime oke osimiri ga si n'Amazọn abịa.

translation.en: The main Amazon River is 6,387 km (3,980 miles). It collects water from thousands of smaller rivers.
translation.ig: Isi osimiri Amazọnụ dị km 6,387 (maịlị 3,980). Ọ na-ewetaju mmiri site n’ọtụtụ puku osimiri ndị kara di obere.

translation.en: Although pyramid-building in stone continued until the end of the Old Kingdom, the pyramids of Giza were never surpassed in their size and the technical excellence of their construction.
translation.ig: Agbanyeghị na ọrụrụ-piramidi n’okwute gara n’ihu ruo na njedebe nke Alaeze Ochie, ụmụ piramidi nke Giza bụ ndị agafeghị ma ọlị na nha ha na ima mma nka na ụzụ nke ọrụrụ ha.

translation.en: New Kingdom ancient Egyptians marvelled at their predecessors monuments, which were then well over a thousand year old.
translation.ig: O juru ndị Niu Kịngdọm Ijipt mgbe ochie anya ihe ncheta ndị bu ha ụzọ, nke gaferela otu puku afọ mgbe ahụ.

translation.en: Vatican City's population is around 800. It is the smallest independent country in the world and the country with the lowest population.
translation.ig: Onu ogugu ndi mmadu obodo Vatican di nari 800. O bu obodo kacha nta n’uwa n’uwa n’uwa na obodo n’ogbe ndi kacha pere mpe.

translation.en: Vatican City uses Italian in its legislation and official communications.
translation.ig: Obodo Vatican na-eji asụsụ Italian na iwu na ukara nkwukọrịta ya.

translation.en: Italian is also the everyday language used by most of those who work in the state while Latin is often used in religious ceremonies.
translation.ig: Asụsụ Itali ka ọtụtụ ndị na-arụ ọrụ na steeti na-asụkwa kwa ụbọchị ebe a na-asụkarị Latin n’emume ndị ụka ga.

translation.en: All citizens of Vatican City are Roman Catholic.
translation.ig: Ndị obodo niile nke Obodo Vatican bụ Roman Katọlik.

translation.en: People have known about basic chemical elements such as gold, silver, and copper from antiquity, as these can all be discovered in nature in native form and are relatively simple to mine with primitive tools.
translation.ig: Ndị mmadụ amarala maka isi kemịkalụ njìmebe ndị dị ka ọlaedo, ọlaọcha, ọla kọpa sitere na oge ochie, dị ka enwere ike ịchọpụta ihe ndị a n’ụwa n’ụdị mbupụtaụwa ma dịrị mfe igwupụta n’iji ngwaọrụ ndị mgbe ochie.

translation.en: Aristotle, a philosopher, theorised that everything is made up of a mixture of one or more of four elements. They were earth, water, air, and fire.
translation.ig: Aristotle, bụ onye ọka ihe ọmụma, ekwuola na tiori na ihe niile bụ mgwọkọta njimebe otu ma ọ bụ karịa mejupụtara ya. Ha wụbụ aja, mmiri, ikuku, na ọkụ.

translation.en: This was more like the four states of matter (in the same order): solid, liquid, gas, and plasma, though he also theorised that they change into new substances to form what we see.
translation.ig: Nke a dị kara yiri ọnọdụ anọ nke mata (n’usoro ahụ kwa): nsiriike, mmiri mmiri, ikuku, na plasma, agbanyeghị na o nyere tiori na ha na-agbanwe ghụọ umi ọhụrụ iji mepụta ihe anyị na-ahụ anya.

translation.en: Alloys are basically a mixture of two or more metals. Don't forget that there are many elements on the periodic table.
translation.ig: Ụmụ alọị bụgodu mwurikọta ígwè abụọ ma ọ bụ karịa. Echefula na e nwere ọtụtụ njìmebe nọ na tebụlụ pirịọdik.

translation.en: Elements like calcium and potassium are considered metals. Of course, there are also metals like silver and gold.
translation.ig: Ihe ndị dị ka kalsium na potassium bụ igwe. Ee, enwekwara igwe ndị ọzọ dịka ọla ọcha na ọla edo.

translation.en: You can also have alloys that include small amounts of non-metallic elements like carbon.
translation.ig: I nwekwara ike nwee allọyi nke gụnyere nwa-obere njieme gasị nke enweghị metalik dịka cabọn.

translation.en: Everything in the Universe is made of matter. All matter is made of tiny particles called atoms.
translation.ig: Ihe niile dị na elu ụwa a nwere mata. Mata niile bụ njikọ ọtụtụ obere ihe a na-akpọ atọm.

translation.en: Atoms are so incredibly tiny that trillions of them could fit into the period at the end of this sentence.
translation.ig: Atọm pere nnọọ mpe ruo na puku ijeri ga-abali n'ime akara kpọm nọ na ngwụcha okwu a.

translation.en: Thus, the pencil was a good friend to many people when it came out.
translation.ig: Ya mere, pensụl ahụ wụbụ ezigbo enyị nye ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ mgbe ọ pụtara.

translation.en: Sadly, as newer methods of writing have emerged, the pencil has been relegated to lesser status and uses.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ ihe mwute na ka ụzọ ọhụrụ e si ede ihe na-apụta, 'ọkwa', mkpịsịodee ọkpọọ bụzi ihe a tụlagara n'akụkụ anaghịzikwa eji ya ede ihe mgbe niile.

translation.en: People now write messages on computer screens, never having to come close to a sharpener.
translation.ig: Ndị mmadụ na-edezi ozi na ihuenyo kọmputa gasị, o nweghị mgbe ha na-enwe ịbịaru nso na otu ọmụ nkọ.

translation.en: One can only wonder what the keyboard will become when something newer comes along.
translation.ig: Mmadụ ga na-atụ naanị n’uche ihe kiibọọdụ ga-abụzi mgbe ihe kara dị ọhụrụ bịaziri.

translation.en: The fission bomb works on the principle that it takes energy to put together a nucleus with many protons and neutrons.
translation.ig: Bọmbụ fishọn ahụ na-arụ ọrụ n’iwu na ọ na ewere ike ijikọta otu nuclus ya na ọtụtụ protọnụ na nutrọnụ.

translation.en: Sort of like rolling a heavy cart up a hill. Splitting the nucleus up again then releases some of that energy.
translation.ig: Dika ibinggasi ugbo-ala nke di elu.Nkewa dị na etiti na elụ wee wepụta ike ụfọdụ.

translation.en: Some atoms have unstable nuclei which means that they tend to break apart with little or no nudging.
translation.ig: Ụfọdụ atọm nwere nukei na-anọsighị ike nke pụtara na ha na-agbajikarị n'iji obere ma ọ bụ n'enweghị akwamaka.

translation.en: The surface of the Moon is made of rocks and dust. The outer layer of the Moon is called the crust.
translation.ig: Elu ọnwa bụ ụmụ okwute na ájá mejupụtara ya. Mkpuchi mpụga ọnwa ka a na-akpọ krọstụ.

translation.en: The crust is about 70 km thick on the near side and 100 km thick on the far side.
translation.ig: Crọstụ ahụ dị ihe dị ka km70 n'ịgba agba n'akụkụ ya dị nso na km100 n'ịgba ịgba n'akụkụ ya tere anya.

translation.en: It is thinner under the maria and thicker under the highlands.
translation.ig: Ọ kara taa ahụ n'okpuru marịa ma kara gbaa agba n'okpuru ụmụ ala ugwu ugwu ahụ.

translation.en: There may be more maria on the near side because the crust is thinner. It was easier for lava to rise up to the surface.
translation.ig: E nwere ike nwekwuo marịa ọzọ n'akụkụ ya dị nso n'ihi na krọstụ ya kara taa ahụ. Ọ kara dịrị mfe maka lava ịrịgote n'elu ya ahụ.

translation.en: Content theories are centered on finding what makes people tick or appeals to them.
translation.ig: Tiori ndịnà bụ ndị a gbadoro anya ha ịchọta ihe na-eme ndị mmadụ kpaa agwa ha na-akpa ma ọ bụ ihe na-amasị ha.

translation.en: These theories suggest that people have certain needs and/or desires which have been internalized as they mature to adulthood.
translation.ig: Tiori ndị a na-ekwu na ndị mmadụ nwere mkpa ụfọdụ na/ma ọ bụ ọchịchọ nke ndị e chechala ma tinye n'uche dị ka ha na-etozuru ntorọbịa.

translation.en: These theories look at what it is about certain people that make them want the things that they do and what things in their environment will make them do or not do certain things.
translation.ig: Tiori ndị a na-eleba anya n'ihe gbasara ụfọdụ ndị mmadụ nke kpatara ha ji achọ ihe ndị ha chọrọ na kedu ụmụ ihe nọ na gburugburu ebe obibi ha ga-eme ha mee ma ọ bụ emela ụfọdụ ihe.

translation.en: Two popular content theories are Maslow's Hierarchy of Needs Theory and Hertzberg's Two Factor Theory.
translation.ig: Uzo-echiche ihe-di_n’ime abuo ama ama bu uzo-echiche ogogo nke mkpa nke Maslow na uzo-echiche ihe abuo kpatara nke Hertzberg.

translation.en: Generally speaking, two behaviors can emerge as managers begin to lead their former peers. One end of the spectrum is trying to remain “one of the guys” (or gals).
translation.ig: Ikwu n'izugbe, akparamaagwa abụọ nwere ike ịpụta dịka ndị  nlekọta na-amalite idu ndị ọgbọ ha ochie. Otu mpaghara n'echiche ahụ bụ "ịgbalị ịnọrọ dịka otu n'ime ụmụokorọbịa" (maọbụ ụmụagbọghọbịa).

translation.en: This type of manager has difficulty making unpopular decisions, performing disciplinary action, performance evaluations, assigning responsibility, and holding people accountable.
translation.ig: Ụdịrị onye njikwa a nwere ihe isi ike ime mkpebi ndị amasịghị, ime omume ndị ịdọ aka na ntị, ụmụ nnyocha arụmọrụ, ikenye ibu ọrụ, na ijide ndị mmadụ maka ịza ajụjụ nke ọrụ ha.

translation.en: At the other end of the spectrum, one morphs into an unrecognizable individual that feels he or she must change everything the team has been doing and make it their own.
translation.ig: Na njedebe ọzọ nke ụdị ahụ, otu onye ahụ ga-aghọ wụrụ mmadụ a na agali amata nke na- eche na ọ ga-agbanwerịrị ihe niile otu ahụ na- eme ma mee ka ọ bụrụ nke ha.

translation.en: After all, the leader is ultimately responsible for the success and failure of the team.
translation.ig: Kaosiladị, onye ndu ahụ bụ ya ka ọ dịịrị n'ikpeazụ ịhụ maka ọdịmma na ọdịda nke òtù ahụ.

translation.en: This behavior oftentimes results in rifts between the leaders and the rest of the team.
translation.ig: Omume a ọtụtụ mgbe na adapụta n'esemokwu n'etiti ndị isi na ndị òtù ndị ọzọ fọdụrụnụ.

translation.en: Virtual teams are held to the same standards of excellence as conventional teams, but there are subtle differences.
translation.ig: A na-ebugowe otu egwuregwu ndị a na-ejighi n'aka n'otu ụdị ụkpụrụ mmapụrụiche dịka otu egwuregwu ndị nke a ma ama, mana ndịiche dị n'etiti ha nke n'eweghi anya.

translation.en: Virtual team members often function as the point of contact for their immediate physical group.
translation.ig: Ndịòtù òtù kedịnuche na-arụkarị ọrụ dị ka ebe nzute mbụ maka òtù ozugbo ha keanahụanya.

translation.en: They often have more autonomy than conventional team members as their teams may meet according to varying time zones which may not be understood by their local management.
translation.ig: Ha na enwekwuru ikike ichoro onwe ha karia ndiotu otu ha na ha dika otu ha nwere ike izute na-ndabere n’oge na-adi iche iche nke obodo ha nwere ike njikwa obodo ha agaghi aghota ya.

translation.en: The presence of a true “invisible team” (Larson and LaFasto, 1989, p109) is also a unique component of a virtual team.
translation.ig: Ọnụnọ nke otu "òtù anaghị ahụ anya" n'ezie (Larson na LaFasto, 1989, p109) bụkwa otu ǹsòmebe pụrụ iche nke otu òtù kendịnuche.

translation.en: The “invisible team” is the management team to which each of the members report. The invisible team sets the standards for each member.
translation.ig: “Òtù anaghị ahụ anya” ahụ bụ òtù njikwa nke onye ọ bụla n’ime ndịòtù ahụ na-ekpesa. Òtù anaghị ahụ anya ahụ na-ewube ọkọlọtọ maka onyeòtù ọ bụla.

translation.en: Why would an organization want to go through the time consuming process of establishing a learning organization? One goal for putting organizational learning concepts into practice is innovation.
translation.ig: Gịnị mere otu ụlọọrụ ga-achọ ịgafe n'ime usoro na-egbu oge nke iwube otu ụlọọrụ ọmụmụ? Otu ebumnobi maka itinye echiche ọmụmụ keụlọọrụ n'ime ọrụ bụ nkepụta ihe ọhụrụ.

translation.en: When all available resources are effectively used across the functional departments of an organization, creativity and ingenuity can transpire.
translation.ig: Mgbe e tinyere ngwaọrụ niile dị adị n’ọrụ n’ụzọ bara uru n’ime ngalaba niile na-arụ ọrụ n'ụlọọrụ ọbụla, nrụpụta ihe na amamihe pụrụ iche ga-enwe ike puta ihe.

translation.en: As a result, the process of an organization working together to overcome an obstacle can lead to a new innovative process to serve the customer's need.
translation.ig: N'ihi nke a, usoro nke otu ụlọọrụ ịrụkọta ọrụ ọnụ iji merie otu ihe mgbochi nwere ike idunyeru otu usoro nkpepụta ihe ọhụrụ iji jee ozi nke mkpa onye ahịa.

translation.en: Before an organization can be innovative, leadership must create a culture of innovation as well as shared knowledge and organizational learning.
translation.ig: Tupu ulo-oru obula enwee ike idi n’eweputa uche-ohuru, nduzi aghaghi ikepuya omenala uche-ohuu dika kwa nkerita nghota na imu ihe nke ulo-oru.

translation.en: Angel (2006), explains the Continuum approach as a method being used to help organizations reach a higher level of performance.
translation.ig: Angel (2006), kowara ukpuru nke agamnihu dika omume nke ejiri nyere otutu ulo-oru aka iru ogo di-elu nke iruputa ihe.

translation.en: Neurobiological data provide physical evidence for a theoretical approach to the investigation of cognition. Therefore it narrows the research area and makes it much more exact.
translation.ig: Ozi ihe-omumundu-banyere-uburu ewetala akaebe ana ahu anya maka usoro kowaputa nye nyocha nke nkota. Nihi ya obelatala ogbe nchoputa ma mee ya kpom-kwem nke ukwu karia.

translation.en: The correlation between brain pathology and behaviour supports scientists in their research.
translation.ig: Mmekọrịta n’etiti patọlọji ụbụrụ na omume kwadoro ndị ọka mmụta sayensị na nnyocha ha.

translation.en: It has been known for a long time that different types of brain damage, traumas, lesions, and tumours affect behaviour and cause changes in some mental functions.
translation.ig: Obu ihe ama-ama site na mgbe di anya na otutu mmeru-ahu uburu, mmeru-ahu uche , mmeru-ahu nke ahu, na otuto nke uburu n’emututa akparama-agwa ma kpatakwa mgbanwe na oru oburu ufodu.

translation.en: The rise of new technologies allows us to see and investigate brain structures and processes never seen before.
translation.ig: Mmụbanye nke ụmụ teknụzụ ọhụrụ na-enye anyị ohere ịhụ ma nyochaa ọdịdị na arụmarụ ụbụrụ nke a na-ahụbeghị mbụ.

translation.en: This provides us with a lot of information and material to build simulation models which help us to understand processes in our mind.
translation.ig: Nke a na-akuziri anyị ọtụtụ ihe ma na-enye anyị ihe anyị ji arụ oyiri ya nke na-enyere anyị aka ịghọta usoro n'uche anyị.

translation.en: Although AI has a strong connotation of science fiction, AI forms a very important branch of computer science, dealing with behavior, learning and intelligent adaptation in a machine.
translation.ig: Agbanyeghị na AI na-ada ka ihe gbasara akụkọ ifo sayensị, AI bụ ngalaba dị oke mkpa na sayensị kọmputa, nke gbasara etu igwe si eme omume, amụta ihe ma na-agbanwe dabere n'ihe ọ mụtara.

translation.en: Research in AI involves making machines to automate tasks that require intelligent behavior.
translation.ig: Nchọpụta na ngalaba AI gụnyere ịmepụta igwe ndị ga na-arụ ụmụ ọrụ ndị na-achọ amamihe nwere usoro.

translation.en: Examples include control, planning and scheduling, the ability to answer customer diagnoses and questions, as well as handwriting recognition, voice and face.
translation.ig: Ọmumatụ gụnyere njikwa, ịtụ arọ na ịhàzi oge, ike ịza ụmụ nchọpụta ọrịa na ajụjụ onye ahịa, ya na ịmata aka odide, olu na ihu.

translation.en: Such things have become separate disciplines, which focus on providing solutions to real life problems.
translation.ig: Ụdị ihe ndị ahụ aghụọla nkebi ọzụzụ ndị iche, nke na-agbado anya na-enye ụmụ azịza maka ụmụ nsogbu keụwa dị ire.

translation.en: The AI ​​system is now often used in the fields of economics, medicine, engineering and the military, as has been built in several home computer and video game software applications.
translation.ig: Ukpuru nke AI ahu buzi nke ana etinyezi ugbua n’ihe banyere aku-n’uba, ogwu, ikpu-uzu na ndi-agha, dika arunyere n’ime ututu igwe komputa digasi iche-iche ndi ana eji n’ulo ya na ihe ntinye ihe egwuregwu onyonyo.

translation.en: Field trips are a large part of any classroom. Quite often a teacher would love to take her students places to which a bus trip is not an option.
translation.ig: Njem fild bụ otu nnukwu akụkụ nke klaasị ọ bụla. Ọtụtụ mgbe ọ na-amasị otu onye nkuzi ịkpọrọ ụmụ akwụkwọ ya gaa ebe ndị njem bọọsụ esoghị na nhọrọ ya.

translation.en: Technology offers the solution with virtual field trips. Students can look at museum artifacts, visit an aquarium, or admire beautiful art while sitting with their class.
translation.ig: Nka na uza n’enye igbo-mkpa nke ime jem site ihu-nanya. Umu-akwukwo nwere ike ilele ihe ngosi n’ulo ngosi, zute ebe izu-azu maobu gosi mmasi nye oru nka dika ha no-odu n’ogige ulo-akwukwo ha.

translation.en: Sharing a field trip virtually is also a great way to reflect a on a trip and share experiences with future classes.
translation.ig: Ịkekọrịta njem site na kọmputa bụkwa otu ụzọ dị mma iji chee echiche na njem ma kekọrịta ahụmahụ nye klas ndị nke ọdịnihu.

translation.en: For example, each year students from Bennet School in North Carolina design a website about their trip to the State Capital, each year the website gets remodeled, but old versions are kept online to serve as a scrapbook.
translation.ig: Na imaatu, kwa afo umu-akwukwo sitere Ulo-akwukwo Bennet di na mpaghara ugwu Carolina na aruputa otu websaiti banyere njem ha na Isi Obodo, kwa afo aga arozihari websaiti a, mana aga edowe udidi ochie ya na ikuku iru oru dika akwukwo-efu.

translation.en: Blogs can also help improve student writing. While students often begin their blog experience with sloppy grammar and spelling, the presence of an audience generally changes that.
translation.ig: Ụmụ blọọgụ nwerekwara ike inye aka imelite ederede nwa akwụkwọ. Dị ka ụmụ akwụkwọ na-ebidokarị ahụmihe blọọgụ ha n'iji ụtọasụsụ na nsụpe na-adịghị nke ọma, ọnụnọ nke ndị nkiri na-agbanwekarị nke ahụ.

translation.en: Since students are often the most critical audience, the blog writer begins to strive to improve writing to avoid criticism.
translation.ig: Ebe ọ bụ na ụmụ akwụkwọ na-abụkarị ndị nkiri kachasị mkpa, odee blọọgụ ahụ na-amalite ịgbalị imelite odide ya iji zere nkatọ.

translation.en: Also blogging "forces students to become more savvy about the world around them." The need to feed the interest of the audience inspires students to be clever and interesting (Toto, 2004).
translation.ig: Nakwa ime blọọgụ "na-akwanye ụmụakwụkwọ ịmatakwu ihe gbasara ụwa gbara ha gburugburu." Mkpa nke ịkwalite mmasị nke ndị nkiri na-akpali ụmụakwụkwọ inwe amamihe ma na-adọrọ mmasị (Toto, 2004).

translation.en: Blogging is a tool that inspires collaboration, and encourages students to extend learning well beyond the traditional school day.
translation.ig: Ide blogu bu ngwa oru na akpalite mmekorita, o na akwadokwa umuakwukwo ka ha gbatiaa mmuta ha karia mmuta n’ulo akwukwo.

translation.en: Appropriate use of blogs "can empower students to become more analytical and critical; through actively responding to Internet materials, students can define their positions in the context of others' writings as well as outline their own perspectives on particular issues (Oravec, 2002).
translation.ig: Ojiji kwesịrị ekwesị nke ụmụ blọọgụ "nwere ike inye ụmụ akwụkwọ ike iji dịkwuo na kennyocha na ichekwu echiche; site n'ịza ọsịsọ n'ụmụ ihe ịntaneet, ụmụ akwụkwọ nwere ike ịkọwa ọnọdụ ha na nghọta nke ụmụ ederede ndị ọzọ ya na kwupụtachaa uche onwe ha n'ụmụ nsogbu pụrụ iche (Oravec, 2002).

translation.en: Ottawa is Canada's charming, bilingual capital and features an array of art galleries and museums that showcase Canada's past and present.
translation.ig: Ottawa bu isi obodo mara mma, nwere asusu abuo nke Canada ma nwekwa galari nka na ebe ngosi nka di iche iche n’egosiputa Canada n’oge gara aga ma n’oge ugbu a.

translation.en: Farther south is Niagara Falls and the north is home to the untapped natural beauty of the Muskoka and beyond.
translation.ig: Igakwuo ndida bu Mkpoda-mmiri Niagara ma mpaghara ugwu bu ulo nye nma udidi na emetubeghi aka nke Muskoka ma gafere.

translation.en: All these things and more highlight Ontario as what is considered quintessentially Canadian by outsiders.
translation.ig: Ihe ndị a niile na ọzọ na-egosipụta Ọntario dị ka ihe echere na ọ bụ site n'ogo kachasị zuo oke Ndị Kanada site n'aka ndị ọbịa.

translation.en: Large areas further north are quite sparsely populated and some is nearly uninhabited wilderness.
translation.ig: Ebe ndị buru ibu na ngapụga ugwu bụ ọzara nke obere ndị mmadụ bi ma ụfọdụ fọrọ nke nta ka ọ bụrụ ebe ndị mmadụ ebighị.

translation.en: For a comparison of population that surprises many: There are more African Americans living in the US than there are Canadian citizens.
translation.ig: Otu ntule ọnụ ọgụgụ na-agbagwoju ọtụtụ ndị mmadụ anya: Ndị isi ojii amerịka bi na mba Amerịka karịrị ndị Kanada bi ebe ahụ n'ọnụ ọgụgụ.

translation.en: The East African Islands are in the Indian Ocean off the eastern coast of Africa.
translation.ig: Obodo-akuku-mmiri nke ndi Owuwa-anyanwu Africa di na Osimiri India na opupu onu mmiri owuwa-anyanwu Africa.

translation.en: Madagascar is by far the biggest, and a continent on its own when it comes to wildlife.
translation.ig: Madagaaka kachasị buo ibu, ma bụrụkwa kọntinentị nọọrọ onwe ya ma a bịa n'ihe gbasara anụmanụ ndị bi n'ọhịa.

translation.en: Most of the smaller islands are independent nations, or associated with France, and known as luxury beach resorts.
translation.ig: Ọtụtụ agwaetiti ndị ka obere bụ mba ndị kwụụrụ onwe ha, maọbụ nọrọ na njiko ha na France, ndị a makwaara dịka rezọt ọnụ osimiri bu ebe mkporindụ.

translation.en: The Arabs also brought Islam to the lands, and it took in a big way in the Comoros and Mayotte.
translation.ig: Ndị Arabụ wetekwara okpukpere Alakụba n'ala ndị ahụ, ma a nabatara ya nke ukwuu na mba Komoros na Mayọtụ.

translation.en: European influence and colonialism began in the 15th century, as Portuguese explorer Vasco da Gama found the Cape Route from Europe to India.
translation.ig: Ike onwunwe ndị Yurop ọchịchị ala ọzọ bidoro n’ime narị afọ nke iri na ise, dị ka one ngagharị one Pọtugalụ Vasco da Gama chọtara Ụzọ Kepụ site na Yurop ruo Indịa.

translation.en: In the north the region is bounded by the Sahel, and in the south and west by the Atlantic Ocean.
translation.ig: N'akụkụ ugwu, Sahel gbara mpaghara a ogige; na ndịda ma n'ọdịda anyanwụ, Oke osimiri atlantik gbara ya ogige.

translation.en: Women: It is recommended that any women travellers say that they are married, regardless of actual marital status.
translation.ig: Ụmụ nwanyị: Ọ bụ ihe akwadoro na ndị njem nwanyị ọ bụla kwuo na ha alụọla dị, n'agbanyeghị etu ọnọdụ ha dị n'ezie.

translation.en: It is helpful to also wear a ring (just not one that looks too expensive.
translation.ig: Ọ na-enyekwara aka ịgba otu ọlaaka (naanị ọ bụghị nke yiri ka ọ dị oke ọnụ).

translation.en: Women should realize that cultural differences may result in what they would consider harassment and it is not uncommon to be followed, grabbed by the arm, etc.
translation.ig: Ụmụ nwanyị kwesịrị ịghọta na ndịiche omenala nwere ike ịkpata ihe ha ga-ewere dị ka ịchọ okwu ma ọ bụghị ihe a na-ara ahụ ịhụ isoro gị, ijide site n'aka, dgz.

translation.en: Be firm in turning down men, and don't be afraid to stand your ground (cultural differences or not, it doesn't make it ok!).
translation.ig: Guzosie ike n'ịsị ụmụ nwoke mba, ma atụla egwu ịkwechiri (na-agbanyeghi ọdịnala ọbụla nke ọ bụ, o kwesighi ekwesi!).

translation.en: The modern city of Casablanca was founded by Berber fishermen in the 10th century BCE, and was used by the Phoenicians, Romans, and the Merenids as a strategic port called Anfa.
translation.ig: Obodo nke Casablanca nke ugbu a bụ Berber fishermen wubere ya na BCE narị afọ nke iri, ma ndị Phoenicia, Rome, na ndị Merenid jiri ya dị ka ọdụ ụgbọ mmiri dị oke mkpa akpọrọ Anfa.

translation.en: The Portuguese destroyed it and rebuilt it under the name Casa Branca, only to abandon it after an earthquake in 1755.
translation.ig: Ndị Pọtụgaalụ bibiri ya ma rụgharịa ya n’okpuru aha Casa Branca, naanị ịgbahapụ ya mgbe otu ala ọma jijiji mechara n’ime 1755.

translation.en: The Moroccan sultan rebuilt the city as Daru l-Badya and it was given the name Casablanca by Spanish traders who established trading bases there.
translation.ig: Sọltan Ndị Moroko ahụ rụgharịrị obodo ahụ dị ka Darụ-I-Badya ma e nyere ya aha Casablanka site n'aka Ndị Spen na-azụ ahịa ndị wubere isi ebe ndị a na-ere ahịa ebe ahụ.

translation.en: Casablanca is one of the least interesting places to shop in all of Morocco.
translation.ig: Casablanca bụ otu n'ime opekata mpe ebe na-adọrọ mmasị ịzụ ahịa na Morocco niile.

translation.en: Around the old Medina it's easy to find places selling traditional Moroccan goods, such as tagines, pottery, leather goods, hookahs, and a whole spectrum of geegaws, but it's all for the tourists.
translation.ig: Gburugburu Medina ochie ahụ ọ dị mfe ịchọta ebe ndị na-ere ụmụ ngwaahịa ọdịnala Ndị Moroko, dị ka ụmụ tagịnị, ite akpụrụ akpụ, ngwaahịa ejiri akpụkpọ anụ mee, huuka, na giigawụ nke ụdịdị dị iche iche zuru ezu, mana ha nille bụ maka ndị nleta.

translation.en: Goma is a tourist city of the Democratic Republic of Congo in the extreme east near Rwanda.
translation.ig: Goma bụ obodo nleta nke Democratic Replublic nke Kongo n'ime akụkụ ọwụwa anyanwụ kachasị anya na nso Rwanda.

translation.en: In 2002 Goma was destroyed by lava from the Nyiragongo volcano which buried most of the town’s streets, particularly the town centre.
translation.ig: N'afọ 2002, ebibiri Goma site n’aka lava si na ugwu ọkụ Nyiragongo nke liri ọtụtụ n'okporoama obodo, ọ kachasị etiti obodo.

translation.en: While Goma is reasonably safe, any visits outside of Goma should be researched to understand the state of the fighting that persists in the North Kivu province.
translation.ig: Dịka Goma nwetụrụ nchekwa n’ụdị dịtụ mma, nleta ọ bụla na mpụga Goma bụ nke ekwesịrị inyocha iji ghọta ọnọdụ nke ọgụ ka nogidesiri ike n’Ugwu ngalaba ọchịchị kizu.

translation.en: The city is also the base to climb the Nyiragongo volcano along with some of the cheapest Mountain Gorilla tracking in Africa.
translation.ig: Obodo ahụ bụkwa ntọala ịrị ugwu mgbawa Nyiragongo tinyere ụfọdụ nsochi Ọzọdimgba Ugwu dịchasị ọnụ ala n'Afrịka.

translation.en: You can use boda-boda (motorcycle taxi) to get around Goma. The normal (local) price is ~500 Congolese Francs for the short ride.
translation.ig: Ị nwere ike iji boda-boda (tagzi ọgba tum tum) ịga gburugburu Goma. Ọnụahịa nkịtị (ebeụlọ) bụ Francs Ndị Congo ~500 maka ọkwụkwọ dị mkpirikpi.

translation.en: Combined with its relative inaccessibility, "Timbuktu" has come to be used as a metaphor for exotic, distant lands.
translation.ig: Tinyere na ira-ahu na nweta ya karia ibe ya, "Timbuktu" aburula ihe eji ama-atu maka ala ndi di anya, di oke-onu.

translation.en: Today, Timbuktu is an impoverished town, although its reputation makes it a tourist attraction, and it has an airport.
translation.ig: Taa, Timbuktu obodo agụọ na-egbu, agbanyeghị n'ugwu ya na-eme ya otu ndọta ndị nleta, na o nwere otu ọdụ ụgbọelu.

translation.en: In 1990, it was added to the list of world heritage sites in danger, due to the threat of desert sands.
translation.ig: N'afọ 1990, e debanyere ya n'etiti ebe ọpụrụiche n'ụwa ndị nọ na nsogbu mkpochapụ, maka nsogbu aja si n'ọzara.

translation.en: It was one of the major stops during Henry Louis Gates' PBS special Wonders of the African World.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ otu isi nkwụsịtụ n'oge Henry Louis Gates Ihe-ebube pụrụ iche PBS nke Ụwa Afrịka.

translation.en: The city is in stark contrast to the rest of the country's cities, because it has more of an Arabic flair than of an African.
translation.ig: Obodo ahụ dị n'ọdịiche kachasị ya n'ụmụ obodo nke mba ahụ fọdụrụnụ, n'ihi na o nwere karịa mmasị nke Arabik karịa otu Onye Afrịka.

translation.en: The Kruger National Park (KNP) lies in the north-east of South Africa and runs along the border of Mozambique in the east, Zimbabwe in the north, and the southern border is the Crocodile River.
translation.ig: Obianụọhịa Kemba Kruger (KNP) nọ n'ebe ugwu-ọwụwa anyanwu nke South Afrịka ma nọrọ ogologo ókè ahụ nke Mozambik n'ime ọwụwa anyanwụ, Zimbabwe n'ime ebe ugwu, na ókè ebe ndịda ahụ bụ Osimmiri Agụiyi.

translation.en: The park covers 19,500 km² and is divided in 14 different ecozones, each supporting different wildlife.
translation.ig: Ogige a ruru 19,500 km² nakwa ekewara ya n'ụzọ mpaghara ecozone 14, ebe nke ọbụla na-akwado ụdịrị anụ ọhịa dị iche.

translation.en: It is one of the main attractions of South Africa and it is considered the flagship of South African National Parks (SANParks).
translation.ig: Ọ bụ otu n’ime nke isi ihe ndọta nke Ndịda Afrịka ma a na-ewe ya dị ka nke kacha mma nke Ebennọkọta Nkeobodo (SANParks) Ndịda Afrịka.

translation.en: As with all South African National Parks, there are daily conservation and entry fees for the park.
translation.ig: Dịka o si adị n'ogige mba niile nọ na Sawụtụ Afrịka, e nwere ụgwọ nchekwa n mbanye a na-akwụ kwa ụbọchị n'ogige a.

translation.en: It may also be beneficial for one to buy a Wild Card, which provides entry to either selections of parks in South Africa or all of the South African National Parks.
translation.ig: O nwekwara ike iba uru ka mmadu gote Kaadi Ohia nke ga-enye gi ikikere iji banye na ogige ahoputagoro na South Africa ma o bu na Ogige Kemba South Africa niile.

translation.en: Hong Kong Island gives the territory of Hong Kong its name and is the place that many tourists regard as the main focus.
translation.ig: Ọ bụ site na Agwaetiti Họng Kọng ka mpaghara Họng Kọng nwetara aha ya; Ọ bụkwa ebe a ka ndị njem nlereanya na-ahụta dịka ebe kachasị mkpa.

translation.en: The parade of buildings that make the Hong Kong skyline has been likened to a glittering bar chart that is made apparent by the presence of the waters of Victoria Harbour.
translation.ig: E jirila ụmụ ogologo ụlọ elu na-achọ igwe Họng Kọng mma maa atụ na ha yiri eserese baa chat, nke mmiri Viktoria Habọ mere ka ọ pụta ihe.

translation.en: To get the best views of Hong Kong, leave the island and head for the Kowloon waterfront opposite.
translation.ig: Ịhụta Họng Kọng n'ụzọ kachasị mma, pụọ n'agwaetiti gawa na Kowloon, mpaghara akụkụ mmiri, nke chere gị ihu.

translation.en: The great majority of Hong Kong Island's urban development is densely packed on reclaimed land along the northern shore.
translation.ig: Oke ihe ka n'ọnụ ọgụgụ n'ime mmepe obodo nke Agwaetiti Hong Kong jupụtara n'ọnụ na ala a napụtara na mmiri dị n'ogologo ụzọ nke ugwu akụkụ oke osimiri.

translation.en: This is the place the British colonisers took as their own and so if you are looking for evidence of the territory's colonial past, this is a good place to start.
translation.ig: Ebe a bụ ebe ndị nchịkwa mba si Britenụ were dịka nke ha ya mere ọ bụrụ na ị na-achọ maka akaebe nke nchịkwa ókèala ahụ gara aga, ebe a bụ ebe dị mma ịmalite.

translation.en: The Sundarbans are the largest littoral mangrove belt in the world, stretching 80 km (50 mi) into the Bangladeshi and Indian hinterland from the coast.
translation.ig: Ebe Sundarbans bụ ebe ala nwere ọhịa mmiri nọ n'akụkụ mmiri kachasị ukwuu n'ụwa dum, na-agbatị ruo kilomita 80 (50 mi) n'ime n'ala Bangladesh na India ahụ nke amaghị ama site n'ụsọ osimiri.

translation.en: The Sundarbans has been declared a UNESCO World Heritage Site. The part of the forest within Indian territory is called Sundarbans National Park.
translation.ig: E kwupụtawo na Sundarbans bụ otu Ebe Nketa Keụwa UNESCO. Akụkụ nke oke ọhịa n'ime ókèala nke Indịa ka a na-akpọ Obianụọhịa Kemba Sundarbans.

translation.en: The forests aren't just mangrove swamps though — they include some of the last remaining stands of the mighty jungles which once covered the Gangetic plain.
translation.ig: Ọhịa ndị a abụghịkwa sọọsọ apịtị mangrov dị na ha – ha gụnyekwara ihe ndị ka fọrọ site n'oke ọhịa ndị juburu Ala nọ na mpaghara Ganjiz.

translation.en: The Sundarbans cover an area of 3,850 km², of which about one-third is covered in water/marsh areas.
translation.ig: Sundabans kpuchiri ohere km² 3850, nke mmiri maọbụ ala apịtị kpuchiri otu ụzọ n'ụzọ atọ ya.

translation.en: Since 1966 the Sundarbans have been a wildlife sanctuary, and it is estimated that there are now 400 Royal Bengal tigers and about 30,000 spotted deer in the area.
translation.ig: Ka mgbe 1966, ka Sundarbans ji buru ebe obibi nso anu ohia ana asi na aga enwe ihe dika 400 Royal Bengal tiger na ihe dika 30,000 mgbada nwere ntupo na mpaghara ebe ahu.

translation.en: Buses depart the inter-district bus station (across the river) throughout the day, though most, especially those heading to the east and Jakar/Bumthang leave between 06:30 and 07:30.
translation.ig: Bọọsụ na-esi n'ọdụ ụgbọala njikọ-mpaghara apụ (n'ofe osimiri ahụ) mgbe niile n'ụbọchị, agbanyeghị na nke kacha, tụmadị ndị ahụ na-aga n'ebe ọwụwaanyanwụ na Jakar/Bumthang na-apụ n'etiti 06:30 na 07:30.

translation.en: As the inter-district buses are often full, it is advisable to purchase a ticket a few days in advance.
translation.ig: Dị ka ụmụ bọọsụ njikọ-mpaghara na-ejukarị eju, ọ bụ ezi ndụmọdụ ịzụta otu tiketi ụbọchị ole na ole n'ọdịnihu.

translation.en: Most districts are served by small Japanese Coaster Buses, which are comfortable and sturdy.
translation.ig: A na-ejere imirikiti mpaghara ozi site n'ụmụ Nnukwu Bọọsụ nke ndị Japan, nke dị mma ma sie ike.

translation.en: Shared taxis are a quick and comfortable means to travel to nearby places, such as Paro (Nu 150) and Punakha (Nu 200).
translation.ig: Tagzi ekere eke bụ ụzọ dị ọsịsọ ma maa mma iji gaa ebe dị nso, dịka Paro (Nu 150) na Punakha (Nu 200).

translation.en: The Oyapock River Bridge is a cable-stayed bridge. It spans the Oyapock River to link the cities of Oiapoque in Brazil and Saint-Georges de l'Oyapock in French Guiana.
translation.ig: Akwammiri Osimiri Oyapock bụ otu akwa mmiri ejiri kebùl runye ya. Ọ gbara gburugburu Osimiri Oyapock iji jikọọ ụmụ obodo nke Oiapoque n'ime Brazịl na Saint-Georges de l'Oyapock n'ime French Guiana.

translation.en: The two towers rise to a height of 83 meters, it's 378 meters long and it has two lanes of 3.50 m wide.
translation.ig: Towa abuo ahu rigoro 83 meters, ogologo o bu 378 meters n’ogologo ma o nwekwara obodobo uzo abuo di 3.50m.

translation.en: The vertical clearance under the bridge is 15 meters. Construction was completed in August 2011, it didn't open to traffic until March 2017.
translation.ig: Ogologo ahụ ya kwụ-ọtọ nke akwa mmiri ahụ bụ mita 15. A rụchara ọrụrụ ya n'Ọgọọst 2011, e mepeghị ya nye ụgbọala ruo Maachị 2017.

translation.en: The bridge is scheduled to be fully operational in September 2017, when the Brazilian customs checkpoints are expected to be finished.
translation.ig: E hiwere na akwa ahụ ga-ebido rụwa ọrụ n'uju na Septemba 2017, mgbe a na-ele anya ịrụcha ebe nnyocha nke ụlọọrụ na-ahụ maka ọpụpụ na mbata nke ndị Brazili.

translation.en: The Guaraní were the most significant indigenous group inhabiting what is now Eastern Paraguay, living as semi-nomadic hunters who also practised subsistence agriculture.
translation.ig: Ndị Guaraní bụ otu amaala kachasị gbaa ọkpụrụkpụrụ bi n'eba a na-akpọ ugbua Ọwụwaanyanwụ Paragụwa, ha na-ebi ka ndị dinta na-awagharị awagharị ma na-arụkwa ọrụ ugbo mmepụta nri nke onwe.

translation.en: The Chaco region was home to other groups of indigenous tribes such as the Guaycurú and Payaguá, who survived by hunting, gathering and fishing.
translation.ig: Mpaghara Chako bụ ụlọ nye ụfọdụ agbụrụ amaala ndị ọzọ dịka Guaykuru na Payagua, ndị ji nta, ntụtụkọ, na ịkụ azụ wee zụọ onwe ha nri.

translation.en: In the 16th century Paraguay, formerly called "The Giant Province of the Indies", was born as a result of the encounter of Spanish conquerors with the native indigenous groups.
translation.ig: N'ime narị afọ nke iri na isii Paragwei, a kpọbụrụ "Nnukwu Ngalaba Ọchịchị nke Ndị Indii", bụ nke a mụrụ n'ihi mbịakwute nke ndị mmeri Ndị Spen ya na ụmụ òtù nwaafọ amaala.

translation.en: The Spaniards started the colonization period which lasted for three centuries.
translation.ig: Ndị Spen bidoro oge ọchịchị ike nke digidere ruo narị afọ atọ.

translation.en: Since the foundation of Asunción in 1537, Paraguay has managed to keep a lot of its indigenous character and identity.
translation.ig: Kemgbe ntọala Asunción n’ime 1537, Paraguay agbalịala idobe ọtụtụ n’ime omume na njirimara amaala ya.

translation.en: Argentina is well known for having one of the best polo teams and players in the world.
translation.ig: Amaara mba Ajentịna dịka obodo nwere ndị egwuregwu na otu egwuregwu polo kachasị mma n'ụwa dum.

translation.en: The largest tournament of the year takes place in December at the polo fields in Las Cañitas.
translation.ig: Ndọrọndọrọ kachasị ukwu nke afọ ahụ na-eme na Disemba na fịịldị polo n’ime Las Cañitas.

translation.en: Smaller tournaments and matches can also be seen here at other times of the year.
translation.ig: Obere asọmpi ga na egwuregwu bọlụ ga ka e nwere ike ịhụ ebe a n'oge ụfọdụ n'afọ.

translation.en: For news on tournaments and where to buy tickets for polo matches, check Asociacion Argentina de Polo.
translation.ig: Maka akụkọ gbasara ụmụ ndorondoro na ebe a na-azụ tiketi maka egwuregwu polo, lelee Asociacion Argentina de Polo.

translation.en: The official Falklands currency is the Falkland pound (FKP) whose value is set equivalent to that of one British pound (GBP).
translation.ig: Ego azụmahịa mba Fọlkụlandị bụ pam Fọlkụlandị (FKP) nke ọnụ ya na otu pam ndị Britenị (GBP) ha.

translation.en: Money can be exchanged at the only bank in the islands which is located in Stanley across from the FIC West store.
translation.ig: E nere ike ime mgbanwe ego na naanị otu ụlọ akụ nọ n’agwaetiti ndị ahụ nke a ga-achọtali n’ime Stanley n’ofe site n’ụlọ ahịa FIC West.

translation.en: British pounds will generally be accepted anywhere in the islands and within Stanley credit cards and United States dollars are also often accepted.
translation.ig: A ga-anabata n’izugbe pam ndị Britenụ ebe ọbụla n’ime agwaetiti ndị ahụ ma na gburugburu ụmụ kaadị mbiri ego Stanley na dọla mba Amerịka sokwa na ndị a na-anabata.

translation.en: On the outlying islands credit cards will probably not be accepted, although British and United States currency may be taken; check with the owners in advance to determine what is an acceptable payment method.
translation.ig: N’agwaetiti ndị nọ na mpụga ebe ahụ ụmụ kaadị akwụmụgwọ nwere ike a gaghị anabata ya, n’agbanyeghị na enwere ike iwe ego Britenụ na United States; leru anya na ndị nwe ya n’ọdịnihu iji chọpụta ihe bụ ụzọ nkwụmụgwọ a na-anabata.

translation.en: It is nearly impossible to exchange Falklands currency outside of the islands, so exchange money prior to leaving the islands.
translation.ig: Ọ na-ara ezigbote ahụ ịgbanwe ego Falklands ma e si n'agwaetiti a pụọ, ya mere gbanwee ego gi tupu i si na ya pụọ.

translation.en: Since Montevideo is south of the Equator, it is summer there when it's winter in the Northern Hemisphere and vice versa.
translation.ig: Ebe Montevideo dị na ndịda Iquetọ, ọ bụ oge ọkọchị ebe ahụ mgbe oge oyi dị na Ebe ugwu Emisfee ma n'otu aka ahụ.

translation.en: Montevideo is in the subtropics; in the summer months, temperatures above +30°C are common.
translation.ig: Montevideo nọ n'ime ebe na-ekpọ ọkụ ma jụọkwa oyi; n'ime ụmụ ọnwa ọkọchị, okpomọkụ gafere +30°C bụ ihe nkịtị.

translation.en: The winter can be deceptively chilly: temperatures rarely go below freezing, but the wind and humidity combine to make it feel colder than what the thermometer says.
translation.ig: Oge oyi nwere ike ịjụ ezigbo oyi n'aghụghọ: okpomọkụ na-ara ahụ tupu ya gaa n'okpuru ịghọ okwute mmiri, mana ikuku na oruru mmiri na-abịakọta ọnụ ime ka o nwee mmetụta kara jụọ oyi karịa ihe temometa kwuru.

translation.en: There are no particular "rainy" and "dry" seasons: the amount of rain stays roughly the same throughout the year.
translation.ig: Enweghị ihe dị ka "udu mmiri" na "ọkọchị": ogo mmiri ozuzo na-anọkarị otu ebe ogologo afọ niile.

translation.en: Though many of the animals in the park are used to seeing humans, the wildlife is nonetheless wild and should not be fed or disturbed.
translation.ig: Agbanyeghị na ọ maala ahụ ọtụtụ n'ime ụmụ anụmanụ nọ n'obianụmanụ ịhụ ndị mmadụ, ka o sina dị anụ ọhịa bụ nke azụghịazụ ma e kwesịghị inye ha nri ma ọ bụ nye ha nsogbu.

translation.en: According to park authorities, stay at least 100 yards/meters away from bears and wolves and 25 yards/meters from all other wild animals!
translation.ig: Site n'aka ndị na-ahụ maka ogige anụmanụ, nọtee aka opekata mpe yadị maọbụ mita 100 n'ebe anụ ọhịa bea na wulfu nọ na yadị maọbụ mita 25 n'ebe anụ ọhịa ndị ọzọ niile nọ!

translation.en: No matter how docile they may look, bison, elk, moose, bears, and nearly all large animals can attack.
translation.ig: Agbanyeghị etu ha siri dị nwayọọ, bison, elk, muuz, bea, na anụmanụ ukwu niile nwere ike iluso ọgụ.

translation.en: Each year, dozens of visitors are injured because they didn't keep a proper distance. These animals are large, wild, and potentially dangerous, so give them their space.
translation.ig: Afọ ọ bụla, a na-emerụ ọtụtụ ndị nleta ahụ n'ihi na ha enyeghị ezigbo ohere. Ụmụ anụmanụ ndị a buru ibu, azụghịazụ, ma nweekkwa ike ịbụ ihe ize ndụ, ya mere nye ha ohere.

translation.en: In addition, be aware that odors attract bears and other wildlife, so avoid carrying or cooking odorous foods and keep a clean camp.
translation.ig: Na mgbakwunye, mara amara na usi na adọta ụmụ bea na anụ ọhịa ndị ọzọ, ya mere zere ibu ma ọ bụ isi ụmụ nri na-esi usi ma debe kampụ dị ọcha.

translation.en: Apia is the capital of Samoa. The town is on the island of Upolu and has a population of just under 40,000.
translation.ig: Apia bụ isi obodo Samoa. Obodo ahụ nọ n'agwaetiti Upolu ma ma nwee ngụpụta mmadụ nke ji obere ihe ghara eru 40,000.

translation.en: Apia was founded in the 1850s and has been the official capital of Samoa since 1959.
translation.ig: E kepụtara Apịa n'afọ ndị 1850; kemgbe 1959, ọ bụ isi obodo Samoa.

translation.en: The harbor was the site of an infamous naval standoff in 1889 when seven ships from Germany, the US, and Britain refused to leave the harbor.
translation.ig: Ọdụ ụgbọ mmiri ahụ bụ ebe nguzosike nke ndị agha mmiri wuru ewu na 1889 mgbe nnukwu ụgbọ mmiri asaa si Jamani, US, na Briten jụrụ ịhapụ ọdụ ụgbọ mmiri ahụ.

translation.en: All the ships were sunk, except for one British cruiser. Nearly 200 American and German lives were lost.
translation.ig: Nnukwu ụgbọ mmiri niile ndị ahụ miri, ewezụga otu ụgbọ agha Ndị Briten. Ọ fọrọ obere ka o ruo Ndị Amerịka na Ndị Jamani 200 nwụrụnụ.

translation.en: During the struggle for independence organised by the Mau movement, a peaceful gathering in the town resulted in the killing of the paramount chief Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III.
translation.ig: N'oge mgba maka nnwereonwe nke a haziri site n'aka ngagharị Mau, otu nzukọ keudo n'ime obodo rụpụtara n'ogbugbu nke ezigbo onyeisi Tupua Tamasese Lealofi III.

translation.en: There are many beaches, due to Auckland's straddling of two harbours. The most popular ones are in three areas.
translation.ig: E nwere ọtụtụ ọnụ mmiri, n’ihi nnọnetiti nke Ọklandị nke ọdụ ụgbọ mmiri abụọ. Ndị nke kacha ewu ewu nọ n’ebe atọ.

translation.en: North Shore beaches (in North Harbour district) are on the Pacific Ocean and stretch from Long Bay in the north to Devonport in the south.
translation.ig: Akụkụ mmiri Ọnụmmiri Ugwu (nọ na mpaghara Ugwu Ebe ndote ụgbọ mmiri) nọ n’oke osimiri Pacifik ma dọtịa site na Long Bay nọ n’ugwu ruo Devonport nọ na ndịda.

translation.en: They are almost all sandy beaches with safe swimming, and most have shade provided by pohutukawa trees.
translation.ig: Ha niile fọrọ obere ka ha bụrụchaa akụkụ mmiri aja aja ya na igwu mmiri echedoro echedo, ma ọtụtụ n'ime ha nwere ndo enyere site n'aka ụmụ osisi pohutukawa.

translation.en: Tamaki Drive beaches are on the Waitemata Harbour, in the upmarket suburbs of Mission Bay and St Heliers in Central Auckland.
translation.ig: Ụmụ akụkụ mmiri Tamaki Drive nọ n’Ọdụ ụgbọ mmiri Waitemata ahụ, n’ime ahịa ndị bara ụba nọ mpaghara ebe obibi nke Mission Bay na St Heliers n’ime Central Auckland.

translation.en: These are sometimes-crowded family beaches with a good range of shops lining the shore. Swimming is safe.
translation.ig: Ebe ndị a bụ mgbe ụfọdụ akụkụ mmiri ezinụlọ ndị mmadụ juru ya n’ọtụtụ ụdị ụlọ ahịa nọ n’ogologo ọnụ mmiri ahụ. Igwu mmiri dị mma.

translation.en: The main local beer is 'Number One', it is not a complex beer, but pleasant and refreshing. The other local beer is called "Manta".
translation.ig: Isi biya imeobodo ahụ bụ 'Number One', ọ bụghị biya na-agbagwoju anya, mana dị mma n'ahụ ma na-edo ahụ nke ọma. Biya imeobodo nke ọzọ bụ nke a na-akpọ "Manta".

translation.en: There are many French wines to be had, but the New Zealand and Australian wines might travel better.
translation.ig: Enwere ọtụtụ mmanya si Frans mmadụ ga-aṅụ, mana mmanya Niu Ziland na Ọstrelia ga-aka mma maka njem.

translation.en: The local tap water is perfectly safe to drink, but bottled water is easy to find if you are fearful.
translation.ig: Mmiri mgbata ebeụlọ dị mma nke ọma ịn̄ụ, mana mmiri bọtụlụ dị mfe ịchọta ma ọ bụrụ na ụjọ na-atụ gị.

translation.en: For Australians, the idea of 'flat white' coffee is foreign. A short black is 'espresso', cappuccino comes heaped high with cream (not froth), and tea is served without milk.
translation.ig: Maka ndị Australia, kọfị 'flat white' bụ ihe ala ọzọ. Shọt blak bụ 'espresso', cappuccino na-ebu nnukwu krim abịa (ọ bụghị froth), ha na-añụ tii na-etinyeghị mmiri ara ehi.

translation.en: The hot chocolate is up to Belgian standards. Fruit juices are pricey but excellent.
translation.ig: Chokoleeti ọkụ a ruru ogo nke Beljiọm. Mmanya mkpụrụ osisi dị ọnụ mana ha amaka.

translation.en: Many trips to the reef are made all year around, and injuries due to any of these causes on the reef are rare.
translation.ig: A na-eme ọtụtụ njem ịga na ime ala osimiri gburugburu afọ niile, ma mmerụ ahụ n'ihi otu n'ime ihe mkpata ndị a n'ime ala osimiri ahụ na-ara ahụ inweta.

translation.en: Still, take advice from authorities, obey all signs, and pay close attention to safety warnings.
translation.ig: N’agbanyeghị, were ndụmọdụ si n'aka ndị nọ n’ọchịchị, rube isi n’ihe ntụaka niile, ma gee ntị nke ọma maka ịdọ aka na ntị nke nchekwa.

translation.en: Box jellyfish occur near beaches and near river estuaries from October to April north of 1770. They can occasionally be found outside these times.
translation.ig: Azụjelii igbe na-apụta n'akụkụ ọnụ osimiri ma n'ụso ụmụ njekọta osimiri site n'Ọktoba ruo Eprel ugwu nke 1770. E nwekwara ike ịhụ ha mgbe ụfọdụ n'oge ndị ọzọ n'abụghị oge ndị a.

translation.en: Sharks do exist, however they rarely attack humans. Most sharks are scared of humans and would swim away.
translation.ig: Shaakị gasị dị adị, otú ọ dị, ha adịkarịghị awakpo ụmụ mmadụ. Imirikiti shaakị na-atụ ụmụ mmadụ egwu yana ga-egwu mmiri pụọ.

translation.en: Saltwater Crocodiles do not actively live in the ocean, their primary habitat is in river estuaries north from Rockhampton.
translation.ig: Agụiyi mmiri nnu anaghị ebikewe n'ime oke osimiri, ebe ha na-ebikarị bụ na ngwọkọta osimiri na mmiri nnu dị n'ugwu sitere na Rọkhamptịn.

translation.en: Booking in advance gives the traveller peace of mind that they will have somewhere to sleep once they arrive at their destination.
translation.ig: Itinye akwụkwọ n’ọdịnihu na-enye onye njem ahụ obi udo na ha nwere ebe ha ga-arahụ ụra ozugbo ha rutere ebe ha na-aga.

translation.en: Travel agents often have deals with specific hotels, although you may find it possible to book other forms of accommodation, like camping grounds, through a travel agent.
translation.ig: Ndị nnọchi anya ndị njem na-enwekarị nkwekọ azụmahịa ha na kpọmkwem ụmụ họteelụ, agbanyeghị na ị nwere ike ịhụ na o kwere omume itinye akwụkwọ maka ụdị nnabata ndị ọzọ, dị ka ala ebe a na-ama ụlọikwu, sitere n'otu onye nnọchite anya njem.

translation.en: Travel agents usually offer packages that include breakfast, transportation arrangements to/from the airport or even combined flight and hotel packages.
translation.ig: Ndị nnọchi anya ndị njem na-enyekarị ụmụ ngwungwu na-agụnye nri ụtụtụ, nhazi ụzọ esi eje njem ịga na/site na ọdụ ụgbọelu ma ọ bụ njem ụgbọelu etikọrọ ọnụ ya na ụmụ ngwungwu họteelụ.

translation.en: They can also hold the reservation for you if you need time to think about the offer or procure other documents for your destination (e.g. visa).
translation.ig: Ha nwekwara ike idobere gị ohere a ma ọ bụrụ na ị ka chọrọ oge ịtụgharị uche na ya maọbụ ịnweta akwụkwọ ndị ọzọ maka ebe ị na-aga (ọmụmaatụ: visa).

translation.en: Any amendments or requests though should be coursed through the travel agent first and not directly with the hotel.
translation.ig: Ihe ọbụla a chọrọ ịgbanwe maọbụ ịna, ọ bụ onye ejenti njem ka a ga-ebu ụzọ gakwuru; ọ bụghị họteelụ n'onwe ya.

translation.en: For some festivals, the vast majority of the attendants to music festivals decide to camp on site, and most attendants consider it a vital part of the experience.
translation.ig: Maka ụfọdụ mmemme, nnukwu ọtụtụ n’ime ndị bịara na mmemme egwu ahụ kpebiri ịnọ na kampụ n’ebe ahụ, ma ọtụtụ n’ime ndị bịara na-ewe ya otu akụkụ dị oke mkpa nke ahụmihe ahụ.

translation.en: If you want to be close to the action you're going to have to get in early to get a camping site close to the music.
translation.ig: Ọ bụrụ na ị chọrọ ịnọ nso na emereme ahụ ị ga-ekwesị ịbanye ọsịịsọ iji nweta otu ebe a na-ama ụlọikwu nọ nso n'egwu ahụ.

translation.en: Remember that even though music on the main stages may have finished, there may be sections of the festival that will keep playing music until late into the night.
translation.ig: Cheta na obu ezie na egwu ogbo-egwu nwere ike gwula, enwere ike inwe mpaghara mmeme ahu gana aku egwu ruo ime abali.

translation.en: Some festivals have special camping areas for families with young children.
translation.ig: Ụfọdụ ememme nwere ebe ndị a na-ama ụlọikwuu pụrụ iche maka ezinụlọ nke nwere ụmụ na-eto eto.

translation.en: If crossing the Northern Baltic in winter, check the cabin location, as going through ice causes quite horrible noise for those most affected.
translation.ig: Mgbe ị na-agafe Ebe ugwu Baltic n’oge oyi, lelee ebe kabịn ahụ, dị ka ịgafe okwute mmiri na-akpata mkpọtụ dị nnọọ egwu maka ndị ọ kacha metụta.

translation.en: Saint Petersburg cruises include time in town. Cruise passengers are exempted from visa requirements (check the terms).
translation.ig: Njem nnyagharị nke Senti Piitasbọg gụnyere oge n'ime obodo. Ndị njem nke njem nnyagharị bụ ndị ewezụgara site n'ụmụ ihe ndị achọrọ maka visa (lelee usoro ahụ).

translation.en: Casinos typically make many efforts to maximize time and money spent by guests. Windows and clocks are usually absent, and exits can be hard to find.
translation.ig: Ụlọ chaa chaa gasị na-eme ihe niile ịhụ na ndị mmadụ mefuru oge na ego ha niile. Windo na elekere anaghị adịkewe n'ime ha; ọzọ, ụzọ ọpụpụ na-arakarị ahụ ịchọta.

translation.en: They usually have special food, drink and entertainment offers, to keep guests in a good mood, and keep them at the premise.
translation.ig: Ha na-enwekarị nri pụrụ iche, mmanya na ụmụ onyinye ntụrụndụ, iji debe ndị ọbịa n'ọnọdụ dị mma, ma debe ha n'ogige ahụ.

translation.en: Some venues offer alcoholic beverages on the house. However, drunkenness impairs judgement, and all good gamblers know the importance of staying sober.
